commit_message:
Fix simple-init install type flag

The install-type element is controlled by the
DIB_INSTALLTYPE_* flag[1], not DIB_INSTALL_TYPE. This patch fixes the
variable name so that we really are installing glean from the git
repository and not from pip.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/diskimage-builder/elements/install-types/README.html#environment-variables

Change-Id: I634706f421fbcf3edf1ae9d18a75e2cb9659eefe

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-11-04 06:03:25.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/windows/utils.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/utils.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_utils.py'], 'message': "Ensure to decode bytes or fail

The commit 048316e98114145ad19285cdeedd0040b59a66f8 introduces the
pattern:

  if isinstance(line, bytes):
    try:
      line = line.decode(encoding='utf-8')
    except UnicodeError:
      pass
  # concat line with a string

which is not working in PY3K if an UnicodeError is raised because line
is (silently) not decoded and concatened to a string.

This change ensures to return a text object or to raise an error.

Closes-Bug: #1503415
Blueprint: neutron-python3
Change-Id: I16b8013f33aa3efad65be8040d3210120e047bbd
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure to decode bytes or fail

The commit 048316e98114145ad19285cdeedd0040b59a66f8 introduces the
pattern:

  if isinstance(line, bytes):
    try:
      line = line.decode(encoding='utf-8')
    except UnicodeError:
      pass
  # concat line with a string

which is not working in PY3K if an UnicodeError is raised because line
is (silently) not decoded and concatened to a string.

This change ensures to return a text object or to raise an error.

Closes-Bug: #1503415
Blueprint: neutron-python3
Change-Id: I16b8013f33aa3efad65be8040d3210120e047bbd

commit_message:
Remove default=None for configuration bindings

The default value for a configuration variable is None. There is
no need to specifically set these as None.

The line where this is done is:
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/master/oslo_config/cfg.py#L684

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Iedf29b13d69ea9f2eb4d5aa746d7c1da8d83bafc

commit_message:
Force set network gateway in murano job-template

- Add KEEP_LOCALRC flag into murano job template to
set some variables during deployment.
- Force set network gateway, because it wasn't
setted by DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON.
- Force disable n-net because it wasn't disabled by
DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON.

Change-Id: I708f043564fd792fee494053fe8594e288a5582d

subject: VPNaaS: Remove unneeded test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-05 12:50:50.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/tests/unit/db/vpn/test_vpn_db.py'], 'message': 'VPNaaS: Remove unneeded test

Endpoint groups for VPN, use subnet CIDRs for local endpoints. This test
was added to address the case where a subnet is modified, while being
used by an endpoint group.

However, further investigation indicates that the the subnet CIDR field
is read-only, so it cannot be updated, when in use by an endpoint group.

As a result, this test case is not needed.

Change-Id: I87262949d0e49d42346fae04ab7f6fb989845c47
'}]
commit_message:
VPNaaS: Remove unneeded test

Endpoint groups for VPN, use subnet CIDRs for local endpoints. This test
was added to address the case where a subnet is modified, while being
used by an endpoint group.

However, further investigation indicates that the the subnet CIDR field
is read-only, so it cannot be updated, when in use by an endpoint group.

As a result, this test case is not needed.

Change-Id: I87262949d0e49d42346fae04ab7f6fb989845c47

commit_message:
Add third page (job)

This commit adds the third page to the app which shows detailed test
metrics from a specific job. To access this page user must click on
job name on project detail page.

Co-Authored-By: Caio Carrara <ccarrara@thoughtworks.com>
Change-Id: I5b2b6338906f2758819e765e938f068f61c99900

commit_message:
Don't assume the order of endpoints on get is the same as on create

We don't and should not enforce the order, so enhance the test not to
assume it.

Closes-Bug: #1506482

subject: [contirbutor guide] Amend "word choice" table
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-05 14:22:12.000000000', 'files': ['doc/contributor-guide/source/writing-style/word-choice.rst'], 'message': '[contirbutor guide] Amend "word choice" table

This patch:

1. Corrects a typo in the word "host name" (according to IBM
   Terminology).
2. Removes "open-launch" example, as both words can be used
   depending on context.
3. Changes the synonyms for the word "execute" and adds a
   small explanation for its usage.
4. Adds the word "setup" as a noun for consistency with other
   verb-noun pairs.

Change-Id: Ie167015f7f1800edda21cde082d2c30f15253ceb
'}]
commit_message:
[contirbutor guide] Amend "word choice" table

This patch:

1. Corrects a typo in the word "host name" (according to IBM
   Terminology).
2. Removes "open-launch" example, as both words can be used
   depending on context.
3. Changes the synonyms for the word "execute" and adds a
   small explanation for its usage.
4. Adds the word "setup" as a noun for consistency with other
   verb-noun pairs.

Change-Id: Ie167015f7f1800edda21cde082d2c30f15253ceb

commit_message:

Developer should use timeutils.utcnow to replace the
datetime.datetime.utcnow.

Closes-Bug: #1513308

commit_message:
Fix unit tests according to fallback for openrc file

If "#{home}/openrc" file is not found the default fallback is
'/root/openrc' which shouldn't exist in this test case as well.

Closes-bug: #1513533

Change-Id: Icba36342cba345484e165c85835325949c6e1281

commit_message:
Add FWaaS Reference API Documentation

This commits adds the FWaaS reference API documentation that used
to earlier reside in netconn-api and has now been moved to the
openstack-attic.

Co-Authored-By: Vishnu Badveli <badveli_vishnuus@yahoo.com>
Co-Authored-By: Vishwanath Jayaraman <vishwanathj@hotmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sridar Kandaswamy <skandasw@cisco.com>

(df) Corrected type errors and grammatical errors in common.ent.
(df) Corrected formatting in common.ent.

Closes-bug: #1425658

Change-Id: I58dfe3f40e35a8bd3d86e9e5d430adc37e4cd2db

commit_message:

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2015-11-05 17:31:52.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/approved/optional-shared-storage-flag-in-evacuate-api.rst'], 'message': 'Remove shared storage flag in evacuate API

Today evacuate API expects a onSharedStorage flag to be provided by the admin
however this information can be detected by the virt driver as well. To ease
the work of the admin and to allow easier automation of the evacuation tasks
this spec proposes to remove the onSharedStorage flag from the API.

APIImpact

bp remove-shared-storage-flag-in-evacuate-api

Change-Id: Id820af0d9b77d6ff51bf00542483057870691d7f
'}]
commit_message:
Remove shared storage flag in evacuate API

Today evacuate API expects a onSharedStorage flag to be provided by the admin
however this information can be detected by the virt driver as well. To ease
the work of the admin and to allow easier automation of the evacuation tasks
this spec proposes to remove the onSharedStorage flag from the API.

APIImpact

bp remove-shared-storage-flag-in-evacuate-api

Change-Id: Id820af0d9b77d6ff51bf00542483057870691d7f

subject: Use versionadded and versionchanged in doc
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-05 12:32:15.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_concurrency/lockutils.py', 'oslo_concurrency/fixture/lockutils.py', 'oslo_concurrency/processutils.py', 'oslo_concurrency/watchdog.py'], 'message': 'Use versionadded and versionchanged in doc

Document in which version new types and functions were added using
".. versionadded:: x.y". Document changes using
".. versionchanged:: x.y."

For watchdog module, add the versionadded tag in the module top
docstring, not on each type/function.

Add docstring to ssh_execute().

I used "git blame" + "git tag --contains=SHA1" to find these version,
and then I checked manually each version.

Change-Id: I56a7d8a4335833e9b49eedab026d20adfeedf942
'}]
commit_message:
Use versionadded and versionchanged in doc

Document in which version new types and functions were added using
".. versionadded:: x.y". Document changes using
".. versionchanged:: x.y."

For watchdog module, add the versionadded tag in the module top
docstring, not on each type/function.

Add docstring to ssh_execute().

I used "git blame" + "git tag --contains=SHA1" to find these version,
and then I checked manually each version.

Change-Id: I56a7d8a4335833e9b49eedab026d20adfeedf942

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-10-31 00:35:07.000000000', 'files': ['nova/filters.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_filters.py'], 'message': 'Remove reservation_id from the logs when a schedule fails

As discussed, reservation_id is a compatible layer for EC2 and thus is persisted,
but there are no filters which are using it. Since there are very little benefits
of giving it to the operator (because the operator can find a request by other ways)
and since it would mean we should persist that too in the RequestSpec object,
we prefer to remove that from the log information exposed to the operator.

Change-Id: Ie8f050a1b3653fe1a6d901b3e4020158d63b9b8a
Partially-Implements: blueprint request-spec-object-mitaka
'}]
commit_message:
Remove reservation_id from the logs when a schedule fails

As discussed, reservation_id is a compatible layer for EC2 and thus is persisted,
but there are no filters which are using it. Since there are very little benefits
of giving it to the operator (because the operator can find a request by other ways)
and since it would mean we should persist that too in the RequestSpec object,
we prefer to remove that from the log information exposed to the operator.

Change-Id: Ie8f050a1b3653fe1a6d901b3e4020158d63b9b8a
Partially-Implements: blueprint request-spec-object-mitaka

commit_message:
Allow owner to be set on image create

This change means that on an image create a admin can set the owner
for the image. I believe this was accidently missed as the owner can be
changed in other ways (and there is a command for it in glance client).

Change-Id: I8d572a070bbb04dccdd051b8e0ad199c5754746e
Closes-bug: 1499368

subject: Remove another extraneous get for create_server
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-03 01:43:15.000000000', 'files': ['shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Remove another extraneous get for create_server

The pattern of doing a get after a create is one we've been doing in
Infra for quite a while. However, if we're going to spin off a wait
loop, there is no need for this get, as the only thing we need in the
loop is the server id - which we already have. OTOH, if we're not going
to wait, this is still a useful get to do. Lucky for us, python has a
feature know as "if" which makes expressing this easy.

Change-Id: Ida354fb8fc772325a2fcf8e4ef1dcf3841176e2b
'}]
commit_message:
Remove another extraneous get for create_server

The pattern of doing a get after a create is one we've been doing in
Infra for quite a while. However, if we're going to spin off a wait
loop, there is no need for this get, as the only thing we need in the
loop is the server id - which we already have. OTOH, if we're not going
to wait, this is still a useful get to do. Lucky for us, python has a
feature know as "if" which makes expressing this easy.

Change-Id: Ida354fb8fc772325a2fcf8e4ef1dcf3841176e2b

[{'number': 16, 'created': '2015-10-30 09:42:40.000000000', 'files': ['ironicclient/tests/functional/test_ironicclient.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'ironicclient/tests/functional/base.py'], 'message': "Introduce tempest-lib to functional tests

Functional test environment uses ironicclient api directly(client managers),
this approach has some cons - it doesn't include cli code. So it would be
better to use tempest-lib for this. It makes call to ironic with Popen,
and has parsing tools.

This change doesn't add new test cases, some helper methods have been added.

Change-Id: Iee426c65ee227e8b7c32ac94f6cfc1001f94e112
"}]
commit_message:
Introduce tempest-lib to functional tests

Functional test environment uses ironicclient api directly(client managers),
this approach has some cons - it doesn't include cli code. So it would be
better to use tempest-lib for this. It makes call to ironic with Popen,
and has parsing tools.

This change doesn't add new test cases, some helper methods have been added.

blueprint ironicclient-functional-tests

Change-Id: Iee426c65ee227e8b7c32ac94f6cfc1001f94e112

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-11-05 06:13:14.000000000', 'files': ['thresh/src/test/java/monasca/thresh/domain/model/SubAlarmStatsTest.java', 'thresh/src/main/java/monasca/thresh/infrastructure/thresholding/MetricAggregationBolt.java', 'thresh/src/main/java/monasca/thresh/domain/model/SubAlarmStats.java', 'thresh/src/main/java/monasca/thresh/domain/model/SubAlarm.java', 'thresh/src/test/java/monasca/thresh/domain/model/SubAlarmTest.java', 'thresh/src/test/java/monasca/thresh/infrastructure/thresholding/MetricAggregationBoltTest.java'], 'message': "Evaluate SubAlarms immediately if possible

Some SubAlarm expressions can be evaluated immediately. If the
expression is MAX(m) > 10, a single measurement of m > 10 will cause
the SubAlarm to transition to the ALARM state regardless of any other
measurement of m that is received. However if the operater is < or <=,
MAX can't be immediately evaluated since a following measurement
could be larger than the one storeed.  COUNT also can be evaluated
immediately if the operator is > or >= since it never decreases. MIN
is the opposite and can be immediately evaluated if the operator is
< or <=. AVG and SUM can't be evaluated until the end of the

depending on the measurements received and whether or not they are
negative.

metric is received for the SubAlarm. This could allow the SubAlarm
to be evaluated faster than waiting for the tick tuple since that
is only received every 60 seconds.

Add unit tests for previously untested parts of SubAlarmStats

Change-Id: I989a82328fa4ccc04b49d203f70a1adc9fa4d3bb
"}]
commit_message:
Evaluate SubAlarms immediately if possible

Some SubAlarm expressions can be evaluated immediately. If the
expression is MAX(m) > 10, a single measurement of m > 10 will cause
the SubAlarm to transition to the ALARM state regardless of any other
measurement of m that is received. However if the operater is < or <=,
MAX can't be immediately evaluated since a following measurement
could be larger than the one storeed.  COUNT also can be evaluated
immediately if the operator is > or >= since it never decreases. MIN
is the opposite and can be immediately evaluated if the operator is
< or <=. AVG and SUM can't be evaluated until the end of the
evaluation window since the average or sum could go up or down
depending on the measurements received and whether or not they are
negative.

Also see if the sliding window for a SubAlarm can be slid when a
metric is received for the SubAlarm. This could allow the SubAlarm
to be evaluated faster than waiting for the tick tuple since that
is only received every 60 seconds.

Add unit tests for immediate SubAlarm evaluation.

Add unit tests for previously untested parts of SubAlarmStats

Change-Id: I989a82328fa4ccc04b49d203f70a1adc9fa4d3bb

subject: Don't assume pass_version_arg=False for network
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-05 10:25:27.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/cloud_config.py', 'os_client_config/tests/test_cloud_config.py'], 'message': "Don't assume pass_version_arg=False for network

Excitingly, one of the places where we hard-code a workaround for
a differently behaving client is not needed. The Client in neutron
that takes a version arg is in neutronclient.neutron.client. Also,
pass the version arg as positional when we pass it, as some of the
clients (neutron) require it, and all accept it.

Change-Id: Ifcbaab782173b95a678af0b2792a1194b198b687
"}]
commit_message:
Don't assume pass_version_arg=False for network

Excitingly, one of the places where we hard-code a workaround for
a differently behaving client is not needed. The Client in neutron
that takes a version arg is in neutronclient.neutron.client. Also,
pass the version arg as positional when we pass it, as some of the
clients (neutron) require it, and all accept it.

Change-Id: Ifcbaab782173b95a678af0b2792a1194b198b687

subject: Use assertIn and assertNotIn
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-04 21:36:20.000000000', 'files': ['designate/tests/unit/test_api/test_middleware.py', 'designate/tests/test_api/test_v2/test_hostheaders.py'], 'message': 'Use assertIn and assertNotIn

Tests should use:
  self.assertIn(value, list)
  self.assertNotIn(value, list)

instead of:
  self.assertTrue(value in list)
  self.assertFalse(value in list)

because assertIn and assertNotIn raise more meaningful errors:
  self.assertIn(3, [1, 2]
  >>> MismatchError: 3 not in [1, 2]

  self.assertTrue(3 in [1, 2])
  >>> AssertionError: False is not true

Change-Id: I38bf94b50dbfff8aa075b8ecbb5b4d03a2cdf2e2
Closes-Bug: #1510007
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertIn and assertNotIn

Tests should use:
  self.assertIn(value, list)
  self.assertNotIn(value, list)

instead of:
  self.assertTrue(value in list)
  self.assertFalse(value in list)

because assertIn and assertNotIn raise more meaningful errors:
  self.assertIn(3, [1, 2]
  >>> MismatchError: 3 not in [1, 2]

  self.assertTrue(3 in [1, 2])
  >>> AssertionError: False is not true

Change-Id: I38bf94b50dbfff8aa075b8ecbb5b4d03a2cdf2e2
Closes-Bug: #1510007

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-11-05 14:10:37.000000000', 'files': ['network/config/multiple-nics/ceph-storage.yaml', 'network/config/multiple-nics/README.md', 'network/config/multiple-nics/cinder-storage.yaml', 'network/config/multiple-nics/swift-storage.yaml', 'environments/net-multiple-nics.yaml', 'network/config/multiple-nics/compute.yaml', 'network/config/multiple-nics/controller.yaml'], 'message': 'Add network templates for multiple NIC configuration

This revision changes the ordering of the NICs. By doing that, it
is possible to wire up only a subset of the NICs for the storage

commit_message:
Add network templates for multiple NIC configuration

This change adds a set of network interface configurations for use
with network isolation. The multiple-nics templates includes one
separate NIC per network, and assumes that nic1 is used for the
provisioning network (ctlplane). Also included is an environment
file for including the multiple-nics configuration in a deployment.

This revision changes the ordering of the NICs. By doing that, it
is possible to wire up only a subset of the NICs for the storage
nodes, and it is possilbe to leave the External NIC only configured
on the controllers.

rdo: Updated this commit for static control plane configuration

Co-Authored-By: Rhys Oxenham <roxenham@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic878d1ed1a85b5705295d087a743570ca8213504

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2015-11-03 13:40:40.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/declarative.py', 'ceilometer/meter/notifications.py', 'ceilometer/event/converter.py', 'ceilometer/tests/unit/event/test_converter.py', 'ceilometer/tests/unit/meter/test_notifications.py', 'ceilometer/dispatcher/gnocchi.py'], 'message': 'Factorize yaml loading of declarative stuffs

This change continues to remove code duplication by factorizing the
yaml file loading.

This also homogenizes the error handling.
The precision of error message will be the same for all.
When the yaml file is incorrectly formatted, we now raise an exception,
instead of sometimes raising and sometimes loading an empty definitions,
that can generated an unwanted behavior of collector and notification agents.

Change-Id: I9ae8f519472f1ae2a14e61028a427ba6f3b0d1f3
'}]
commit_message:
Factorize yaml loading of declarative stuffs

This change continues to remove code duplication by factorizing the
yaml file loading.

This also homogenizes the error handling.
The precision of error message will be the same for all.
When the yaml file is incorrectly formatted, we now raise an exception,
instead of sometimes raising and sometimes loading an empty definitions,
that can generated an unwanted behavior of collector and notification agents.

Change-Id: I9ae8f519472f1ae2a14e61028a427ba6f3b0d1f3

Change-Id: I58b006189e700f1c851601b4f64dd0fae931103c
Closes-Bug: #1489676
Co-Authored-By: Tim Potter <tpot@hpe.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7df3a0bea56f654a3d65da27c0e783f775b4ed18)
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up keystone httpd pid files for RPM distros

In some cases we're seeing httpd not cleaning up properly after itself,
which results in the keystone container failing to restart. This is
confirmed to happen on rpm based distros, but have not had any reports
on Ubuntu.

Change-Id: I58b006189e700f1c851601b4f64dd0fae931103c
Closes-Bug: #1489676
Co-Authored-By: Tim Potter <tpot@hpe.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7df3a0bea56f654a3d65da27c0e783f775b4ed18)

commit_message:
Support testing of multiple local subnets

Modify the functional test to support IPSec connections with multiple
local subnets. In addition, refactor the tests, to better reuse code and
cleanup HA support. Pushed the code for setting up the tests into helper
methods/classes.

Regular expressions (perl format) should be used to specify wildcard.
groups: .* # any group
groups: "^(?!mongo$)" # all groups except mongo
groups: (?=mongo)(?=^((?!^primary).)*$) #all mongo, except primary-mongo
groups: "mongo|astute" # mongo or astute

Closes-Bug: #1480930

Change-Id: Id7c2e4de79884789963b4523cb66630afcb33d1d
'}]
commit_message:
Added support of regexp patterns for groups in deployment_tasks.yaml

Regular expressions (perl format) should be used to specify wildcard.
groups: .* # any group
groups: "^(?!mongo$)" # all groups except mongo
groups: (?=mongo)(?=^((?!^primary).)*$) #all mongo, except primary-mongo
groups: "mongo|astute" # mongo or astute

Closes-Bug: #1480930

Change-Id: Id7c2e4de79884789963b4523cb66630afcb33d1d

commit_message:
Set ERROR_ON_CLONE=False.

The use of the git_clone function in commit
42287ef16ddfb70ff8ccfec6c94677e52863c8d7 caused a regression in our
tempest job.  It now fails when trying to clone ovs.

- we now use an alembic migration entry point, instead of
  shipping our own db management tool
- use expand/contract alembic branches
- downgrade is not supported anymore, and we had none, drop it

To allow testing the migration scripts, Neutron is added as a
dependency for tests (in way that avoids cloning the neutron
repo for each test run)

Change-Id: If7ec84af71fd385359b0a68dac9f0563d8f1bf04

commit_message:
Alembic update/cleanup

This change updates and cleans up our alembic migration code:
- we now use an alembic migration entry point, instead of
  shipping our own db management tool
- use expand/contract alembic branches
- downgrade is not supported anymore, and we had none, drop it

To allow testing the migration scripts, Neutron is added as a
dependency for tests (in way that avoids cloning the neutron
repo for each test run)

Pseudo cherry-pick of Ib122895e0a5b07eb1e7b1ec04233c49e95389476

Change-Id: If7ec84af71fd385359b0a68dac9f0563d8f1bf04

revisions:
[{'number': 20, 'created': '2015-11-04 17:17:51.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/test_constraints.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/crypto_helpers.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_encrypter.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py', 'swift/common/exceptions.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_decrypter.py', 'swift/common/middleware/encrypter.py', 'test/unit/proxy/test_sysmeta.py', 'swift/common/constraints.py', 'swift/common/middleware/crypto.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/helpers.py', 'swift/common/middleware/decrypter.py'], 'message': 'Encrypting/Decrypting object metadata

See encryption spec in_progress/at_rest_encryption.html

Adds the encryption and decryption of object metadata.
Specifically the user-metadata, content-type, and the etag.

Depends on having keymaster middleware and cryptography module.
You can point the following vagrant to this patch:
https://github.com/swiftstack/vagrant-swift-all-in-one/tree/crypto
Alternatively, please follow the instructions
in the proxy-server.conf-sample.  You will also need to add the
fake_footers middleware as well to get the correct functionality.

After this change, the functests have 6 errors and 17 failures.  These
are due to not yet having container listings updated, COPY implemented,
and not having a solution for handling conditional GET.

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hp.com>

Change-Id: I194e2329992232499bcca06f48431e7c09b623ed
'}]
commit_message:
Encrypting/Decrypting object metadata

See encryption spec in_progress/at_rest_encryption.html

Adds the encryption and decryption of object metadata.
Specifically the user-metadata, content-type, and the etag.

Depends on having keymaster middleware and cryptography module.
You can point the following vagrant to this patch:
https://github.com/swiftstack/vagrant-swift-all-in-one/tree/crypto
Alternatively, please follow the instructions
in the proxy-server.conf-sample.  You will also need to add the
fake_footers middleware as well to get the correct functionality.

After this change, the functests have 6 errors and 17 failures.  These
are due to not yet having container listings updated, COPY implemented,
and not having a solution for handling conditional GET.

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hp.com>

Change-Id: I194e2329992232499bcca06f48431e7c09b623ed

subject: Update network api version in defaults.json
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-05 10:25:27.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/defaults.json'], 'message': "Update network api version in defaults.json

neutronclient expects 2.0, not 2 - but we'd not noticed because all
of the consumption of client constructors were bypasing the version
arg for neutron. In a follow-up patch we'll fix that, but the
value in defaults.json is just straight wrong.

Change-Id: I684c4ef063193355c6cf936d4f18576db919762b
"}]
commit_message:
Update network api version in defaults.json

neutronclient expects 2.0, not 2 - but we'd not noticed because all
of the consumption of client constructors were bypasing the version
arg for neutron. In a follow-up patch we'll fix that, but the
value in defaults.json is just straight wrong.

Change-Id: I684c4ef063193355c6cf936d4f18576db919762b

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-11-02 14:35:19.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_meta_config.sh', 'inc/meta-config'], 'message': "Provide an error message on bogus config file spec

If local.conf specifies a config file addition in the following way...

[[post-config|$MY_CONF_FILE]]
[xyz]
foo=bar

...and $MY_CONF_FILE points to a file whose directory is not writable by
the user running the script, then stack.sh aborts with the following
obscure message:

  2015-09-01 08:20:08.113 | touch: setting times of '/': Permission denied

This patch modifies inc/meta-config to provide a useful error message,
such as:

  2015-09-01 08:20:08.114 | could not create config file / ($MY_CONF_FILE)

This patch also modifies inc/meta-config so that it provides an error
message if $MY_CONF_FILE is empty (instead of silently ignoring this local.conf
statement):

  2015-09-01 09:38:53.406 | bogus config file specification: $MY_CONF_FILE
  is undefined

Change-Id: I9b78407420318548561012a8672762bc7fdd6db6
Closes-Bug: 1490881
"}]
commit_message:
Provide an error message on bogus config file spec

If local.conf specifies a config file addition in the following way...

[[post-config|$MY_CONF_FILE]]
[xyz]
foo=bar

...and $MY_CONF_FILE points to a file whose directory is not writable by
the user running the script, then stack.sh aborts with the following
obscure message:

  2015-09-01 08:20:08.113 | touch: setting times of '/': Permission denied

This patch modifies inc/meta-config to provide a useful error message,
such as:

  2015-09-01 08:20:08.114 | could not create config file / ($MY_CONF_FILE)

This patch also modifies inc/meta-config so that it provides an error
message if $MY_CONF_FILE is empty (instead of silently ignoring this local.conf
statement):

  2015-09-01 09:38:53.406 | bogus config file specification: $MY_CONF_FILE
  is undefined

Change-Id: I9b78407420318548561012a8672762bc7fdd6db6
Closes-Bug: 1490881

commit_message:
liberty: release python-novaclient 2.30.2

This is a patch release request for a high priority bug fix where users
could request, by default, nova API microversions that the client does
not yet support which leads to failures.

Changes since 2.30.1:

mriedem@ubuntu:~/git/python-novaclient$ git log --oneline --no-merges
2.30.1..
dc49707 Set DEFAULT_OS_COMPUTE_API_VERSION to 2.5

Related-Bug: #1500688

Change-Id: Ide392b3a226d2f174e9b3627dbe183f5ff504f19

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-04 21:06:39.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/approved/no-multiple-instance-boot.rst'], 'message': 'Drop support for booting multiple instances

Currently nova allows the caller to specify "min_count" and "max_count"
parameters in order to cause multiple instances to be booted in one call.
Currently there is no good way for an end user to get information about how
many instances were successfully booted, and if so which ones were booted as a
result of that call. Since we now have orchestration outside of nova which does
a better job of keeping track of that sort of thing, let's drop support for
booting multiple instances from nova.

APIImpact
Implements blueprint no-multiple-instance-boot

Change-Id: I7bdd2324a958d550f964479790b2a22c1941c0cc
'}]
commit_message:
Drop support for booting multiple instances

Currently nova allows the caller to specify "min_count" and "max_count"
parameters in order to cause multiple instances to be booted in one call.
Currently there is no good way for an end user to get information about how
many instances were successfully booted, and if so which ones were booted as a
result of that call. Since we now have orchestration outside of nova which does
a better job of keeping track of that sort of thing, let's drop support for
booting multiple instances from nova.

APIImpact
Implements blueprint no-multiple-instance-boot

Change-Id: I7bdd2324a958d550f964479790b2a22c1941c0cc

commit_message:
XtremIO fix create CG from src flow

Fix a bug suring creating volume with CG,
    that prevented the volume from being added to the CG on the array.
Query array snapshots names for CG snapshot before copying them
    to a new volume.
Add unittest for create_cg_from_src.

liberty-backport-potential

Change-Id: Ida6eb3f7198f7050d8c27fe5560ac8980bb4f0df
Closes-Bug: #1512682

subject: Rename fernet methods to match expiration timestamp
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-16 20:28:19.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/providers/fernet/token_formatters.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/token/test_fernet_provider.py'], 'message': 'Rename fernet methods to match expiration timestamp

Fernet tokens carry the token creation time as part of the Fernet
specification, which is an integer. This is not the case with the token
expiration time, which is carried in the payload of the Fernet token. Keystone
converts the timestamp to a floating point value to save space in the token.
Previously, all the methods handling this conversion, along with the related
tests, communicated that this conversion was to an integer instead of a
float. This change corrects the methods signatures in the Fernet token provider
to be consistent with the timestamp type that is used in the implementation.

Conflicts:
	keystone/token/providers/fernet/token_formatters.py

Change-Id: Ibea9fa0d546948501ebcd9f9f826b1f1319246f2
(cherry picked from commit 94904b305b74e4e9e1b70b7c6e1351febdd6862d)
'}]
commit_message:
Rename fernet methods to match expiration timestamp

Fernet tokens carry the token creation time as part of the Fernet
specification, which is an integer. This is not the case with the token
expiration time, which is carried in the payload of the Fernet token. Keystone
converts the timestamp to a floating point value to save space in the token.
Previously, all the methods handling this conversion, along with the related
tests, communicated that this conversion was to an integer instead of a
float. This change corrects the methods signatures in the Fernet token provider
to be consistent with the timestamp type that is used in the implementation.

Conflicts:
	keystone/token/providers/fernet/token_formatters.py

Change-Id: Ibea9fa0d546948501ebcd9f9f826b1f1319246f2
(cherry picked from commit 94904b305b74e4e9e1b70b7c6e1351febdd6862d)

commit_message:
Log end of router updates for PD and delete branches

These execution branches call continue directly without
logging the end of the router update.  This leads to
confusion about when the last router update finishes if
it is a delete or a PD update.

Change-Id: Id82e7374aa9336e0adea3042238f30f716208373
Signed-off-by: Ryan Moats <rmoats@us.ibm.com>
Closes-bug: #1511004
(cherry picked from commit 70b3d383ac2a0d7d339c551065b9b378a4b9b914)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-05 13:53:17.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/sphinxext.py'], 'message': 'Add section for deliverables with no type

Deliverables which do not have any type were assumed to be
type:service deliverables and were listed with services,
resulting in a crowded and confusing output.

This patch makes sure they are listed in their own section.
It is still wrong for some of them (which should really have the
type:service tag), but less wrong than considering them all as
services.

Change-Id: I828b0fb245443cf5e3fb50c222da3f70c65a014b
'}]
commit_message:
Add section for deliverables with no type

Deliverables which do not have any type were assumed to be
type:service deliverables and were listed with services,
resulting in a crowded and confusing output.

This patch makes sure they are listed in their own section.
It is still wrong for some of them (which should really have the
type:service tag), but less wrong than considering them all as
services.

Change-Id: I828b0fb245443cf5e3fb50c222da3f70c65a014b

commit_message:
Do not throw an error on validation when tunneling is disabled

When neutron tunneling is disabled, allow the passing of neutron network type
without the need for neutron tunnel types.

Change-Id: Ib09ef36507ffbe0589c57d1a23ee6da38ffa0e5a
Closes-Bug: #1507556

commit_message:
Log end of router updates for delete branch

The execution branch for delete calls continue directly
without logging the end of the router update.  This leads
to confusion about when the last router update finishes if
it is a delete.

Signed-off-by: Ryan Moats <rmoats@us.ibm.com>
Closes-bug: #1511004
(cherry picked from commit 70b3d383ac2a0d7d339c551065b9b378a4b9b914)

Change-Id: I543a05d86785407e56613a43ae4afdca9f1b30e1

commit_message:
Allow empty directories for tempest init

tempest init directory parameter is optional. If not
given it uses the cwd as default. Unfortunately this
leads to an error since the existing of the directory
is checked and an error is raised.

Change-Id: I8c6a66df458ae08b29cd921dfa65ef68c76c7a7c
Closes-Bug: #1512994

commit_message:
Extract run aggregation into a separated class

Previously the run aggregation was happening on a long method that was
hard to follow. This commit extracts this logic into its own class as
well includes unit tests around it.

Change-Id: Ib580694c88e8fe032f03d2f2b694ea04f720ba36

commit_message:
Normalize domain data

Keystone will not return a description attribute if no description
was given when creating a domain. So let's normalize the data so
all the things are there that we may expect.

Change-Id: I0fd14d512554853d5a5a052e0517f47a509a35b2

subject: Normalization methods should return Munch
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-04 19:53:33.000000000', 'files': ['shade/_utils.py'], 'message': "Normalization methods should return Munch

For the 1.0 release, we settled on returning Munch objects
rather than plain dicts. However, we didn't arrange for that
in the place where we normalize the returned data.

Change-Id: I9eca96635ddfa012d6c5cff64162de1379f355ee
"}]
commit_message:
Normalization methods should return Munch

For the 1.0 release, we settled on returning Munch objects
rather than plain dicts. However, we didn't arrange for that
in the place where we normalize the returned data.

Change-Id: I9eca96635ddfa012d6c5cff64162de1379f355ee

subject: Fix keystone domain searching
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-04 18:52:22.000000000', 'files': ['shade/operatorcloud.py', 'shade/tests/functional/test_domain.py', 'shade/_tasks.py'], 'message': "Fix keystone domain searching

Domain searches is a bit different in that it pushes down the
filtering to the keystone client. This is fine, except that it
didn't work as the filters were not actually passed.

This change passes the filters, and changes the search_domains()
API to accept a 'filters' parameter to be consistent with our other
search methods. It previously accepted only keyword parameters rather
than just a filter dict.

Change-Id: I61c8591493c5d10de38a6541a9859be2950d60a6
"}]
commit_message:
Fix keystone domain searching

Domain searches is a bit different in that it pushes down the
filtering to the keystone client. This is fine, except that it
didn't work as the filters were not actually passed.

This change passes the filters, and changes the search_domains()
API to accept a 'filters' parameter to be consistent with our other
search methods. It previously accepted only keyword parameters rather
than just a filter dict.

Change-Id: I61c8591493c5d10de38a6541a9859be2950d60a6

subject: Don't warn on configured insecure certs
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-11-04 23:14:19.000000000', 'files': ['shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Don't warn on configured insecure certs

If we have to connect to bogus certs and we know this and we've
configured 'verfiy=False' meaning that we've explicitly indicated
that we want to turn off cert verification, then spamming our logs
with warnings that the certs are invalid is a bit lame. We know. We're
not happy about it - but at least one of our providers has bad certs. We
wish we had the power to change it, but we don't. We already feel bad.
STOP YELLING AT US.

Change-Id: I08d816bcc1685fc9ed3bfcf2e3e8300859059903
"}]
commit_message:
Don't warn on configured insecure certs

If we have to connect to bogus certs and we know this and we've
configured 'verfiy=False' meaning that we've explicitly indicated
that we want to turn off cert verification, then spamming our logs
with warnings that the certs are invalid is a bit lame. We know. We're
not happy about it - but at least one of our providers has bad certs. We
wish we had the power to change it, but we don't. We already feel bad.
STOP YELLING AT US.

Change-Id: I08d816bcc1685fc9ed3bfcf2e3e8300859059903

commit_message:
Multiple floating ranges support

* Remove multiple floating ranges checking from validation layer.
* Rename '_generate_external_network' to 'generate_external_network'.
* Add custom 'generate_external_network' for 'NeutronNetworkDeploymentSerializer80'.
* Change 'NetworkCheck.neutron_check_network_address_spaces_intersection'
  functionality. Now it checks all the floating ranges belong to public network.
* Remove irrelevant unit tests.
* Add unit tests for 'NeutronNetworkDeploymentSerializer80.generate_external_network'.

Change-Id: Ib277506db3c96890bc3ce2b4f312edd10841a95b
Partial-bug: #1490578

commit_message:
remove wheel cache code

Thanks to lifeless, pip now implicitly has a wheel cache so that it
builds a wheel before every install, and uses that cache. All our
clever attempts at manually doing wheelhouse things is actually
bypassing the existing cache and making things take longer.

We should remove all of this code and just let pip do this thing,
which is does very well, and get out of the way.

Change-Id: Ia140dc34638d893b92f66d1ba20efd9522c5923b
(cherry picked from commit 9013bb0c24623ce8d064b561d4fd331e370762e1)

commit_message:
remove wheel cache code

Thanks to lifeless, pip now implicitly has a wheel cache so that it
builds a wheel before every install, and uses that cache. All our
clever attempts at manually doing wheelhouse things is actually
bypassing the existing cache and making things take longer.

We should remove all of this code and just let pip do this thing,
which is does very well, and get out of the way.

Change-Id: Ia140dc34638d893b92f66d1ba20efd9522c5923b

commit_message:
Deprecated: timeutils.strtime & timeutils.isotime

Both oslo_utils.timeutils.strtime & oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime are
deprecated. Start replacing these deprecated calls with the recommended
alternatives:

  http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.utils/api/timeutils.html

There are currently 90 deprecation warnings in the unit test logs for
these two functions. This patch removes about 60 of them.

Partial-Bug: #1479056
Change-Id: I8ab3e8f8751ffa6dc13cae16cd3fae6c242de135
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephen.finucane@intel.com>

commit_message:
Alembic update/cleanup

This change updates and cleans up our alembic migration code:
- we now use an alembic migration entry point, instead of shipping
  our own db management tool
- use expand/contract alembic branches
- downgrade is not supported anymore, and we had none, drop it

To allow testing the migration scripts, Neutron is added
as a dependency for tests (in way that avoids cloning the neutron repo
for each test run)

Change-Id: Ib122895e0a5b07eb1e7b1ec04233c49e95389476

commit_message:
Drop nova_admin_tenant_id_setter

Neutron now has two options nova_admin_tenant_id and nova_admin_tenant_name.
One can just simply specify name of the nova admin tenant instead of probing
the api to get tenant id.

Change-Id: I21dc10396e92906eab4651c318aa2ee62a8e03c7
(cherry picked from commit 919a3a932eccff507a8f974512cb8118ec6609e9)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-05 13:51:23.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/approved/libvirt-hardware-policy-from-libosinfo.rst'], 'message': 'Libvirt hardware policy from libosinfo

When launching an instance Nova needs to make decisions about how to
configure the virtual hardware. Currently these decisions are often
hardcoded, or driven by nova.conf settings, and sometimes by glance
image properties. The goal of this feature is to allow the user to
specify the guest OS type and then drive decisions from this fact,
using the libosinfo database.

Change-Id: I371ce444afc11904adc6816da1fd3bab25c55d60
Co-Authored-By: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
Blueprint: libvirt-hardware-policy-from-libosinfo
Previously-Approved: Liberty'}]
commit_message:
Libvirt hardware policy from libosinfo

When launching an instance Nova needs to make decisions about how to
configure the virtual hardware. Currently these decisions are often
hardcoded, or driven by nova.conf settings, and sometimes by glance
image properties. The goal of this feature is to allow the user to
specify the guest OS type and then drive decisions from this fact,
using the libosinfo database.

Change-Id: I371ce444afc11904adc6816da1fd3bab25c55d60
Co-Authored-By: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
Blueprint: libvirt-hardware-policy-from-libosinfo
Previously-Approved: Liberty

commit_message:
tripleo.sh initial support for stable branches

Adds STABLE_RELEASE variable, which can be set, e.g to "liberty"
such that we configure the repos to use the centos7-liberty current
repos instead of trunk.

This automates the steps documented in:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238600/

Change-Id: I34ea635382114bf4f075f3d8df1188c3beae8727

commit_message:
Alembic update/cleanup

This change updates and cleans up our alembic migration code:
- we now use an alembic migration entry point, instead of shipping
  our own db management tool
- use expand/contract alembic branches
- downgrade is not supported anymore, and we had none, drop it

To allow testing the migration scripts, Neutron is added
as a dependency for tests (in way that avoids cloning the neutron repo
for each test run)

Change-Id: Ie8c889b81e9cc1e1606d69282767abc6fc8e6f1c

Related to blueprint cells-db-connection-switching

Change-Id: I6d6031446098a50ebca9eac6b5e27440e92c2a5a

commit_message:
Database connection switching for cells

In order for Nova API to perform queries on cell databases, the database
connection information for the target cell must be used. Nova API must
pass the cell database connection information to the DB API layer.

Related to blueprint cells-db-connection-switching

Previously-approved: Liberty

Change-Id: I6d6031446098a50ebca9eac6b5e27440e92c2a5a

subject: Alembic update/cleanup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-05 13:34:35.000000000', 'files': ['networking_bagpipe_l2/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/HEADS'], 'message': 'Alembic update/cleanup

This change updates and cleans up our alembic migration code:
- we now use an alembic migration entry point, instead of shipping
  our own db management tool
- use expand/contract alembic branches
- downgrade is not supported anymore, and we had none, drop it

To allow testing the migration scripts, Neutron is added
as a dependency for tests (in way that avoids cloning the neutron repo
for each test run)

Change-Id: Id07f9c9955392ea6eb059181d71a8cb58d2fd035
'}]
commit_message:
Alembic update/cleanup

This change updates and cleans up our alembic migration code:
- we now use an alembic migration entry point, instead of shipping
  our own db management tool
- use expand/contract alembic branches
- downgrade is not supported anymore, and we had none, drop it

To allow testing the migration scripts, Neutron is added
as a dependency for tests (in way that avoids cloning the neutron repo
for each test run)

Change-Id: Id07f9c9955392ea6eb059181d71a8cb58d2fd035

subject: Clean up keystone httpd pid files for RPM distros
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-05 10:41:25.000000000', 'files': ['docker/keystone/extend_start.sh'], 'message': "Clean up keystone httpd pid files for RPM distros

In some cases we're seeing httpd not cleaning up properly after itself,
which results in the keystone container failing to restart. This is
confirmed to happen on rpm based distros, but have not had any reports
on Ubuntu.

Change-Id: I58b006189e700f1c851601b4f64dd0fae931103c
Closes-Bug: #1489676
Co-Authored-By: Tim Potter <tpot@hpe.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up keystone httpd pid files for RPM distros

In some cases we're seeing httpd not cleaning up properly after itself,
which results in the keystone container failing to restart. This is
confirmed to happen on rpm based distros, but have not had any reports
on Ubuntu.

Change-Id: I58b006189e700f1c851601b4f64dd0fae931103c
Closes-Bug: #1489676
Co-Authored-By: Tim Potter <tpot@hpe.com>

subject: Fix BUILD_PACKAGES flag
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-09-28 13:28:29.000000000', 'files': ['requirements-rpm.txt', 'packages/module.mk', 'config.mk', 'packages/rpm/module.mk'], 'message': 'Fix BUILD_PACKAGES flag

Build iso with BUILD_PACKAGES=0:

* Late packages:
  - fuel-bootstrap-image,
  - fuel-target-centos-images,
  - fuel-docker-images,
  should be always build in spite of  BUILD_PACKAGES flag,
  since they are depend on the first level artifacts (packages)
  and are not in the mirrors yet;

* fuel matapackage can be added only after putting all
  dependencies to upstream mirror

* Update requirements-*.txt files with adding all fuel packages

* Make sure the release version of bootstrap, centos-image and
  docker packages is increasing in case of flag PATCHING_CI=1.
  We need to be sure that packages (in packages-late target):
     - fuel-bootstrap-image
     - fuel-target-centos-images
     - fuel-docker-images
    will increase their release numbers by 1 continuously
    in order to be able to ship them in updates repositories.

Change-Id: Iff839e8e6c3db0d7f7c1b3a28fd4f823d780ea7d
Closes-bug: #1460480
'}]
commit_message:
Fix BUILD_PACKAGES flag

Build iso with BUILD_PACKAGES=0:

* Late packages:
  - fuel-bootstrap-image,
  - fuel-target-centos-images,
  - fuel-docker-images,
  should be always build in spite of  BUILD_PACKAGES flag,
  since they are depend on the first level artifacts (packages)
  and are not in the mirrors yet;

* fuel matapackage can be added only after putting all
  dependencies to upstream mirror

* Update requirements-*.txt files with adding all fuel packages

* Make sure the release version of bootstrap, centos-image and
  docker packages is increasing in case of flag PATCHING_CI=1.
  We need to be sure that packages (in packages-late target):
     - fuel-bootstrap-image
     - fuel-target-centos-images
     - fuel-docker-images
    will increase their release numbers by 1 continuously
    in order to be able to ship them in updates repositories.

Change-Id: Iff839e8e6c3db0d7f7c1b3a28fd4f823d780ea7d
Closes-bug: #1460480

in globals.pp

This allows to override this variable from plugin to prevent

commit_message:
Catch use_ovs variable from Nailgun or calculate it for Neutron

in globals.pp

This allows to override this variable from plugin to prevent
from installing Openvswitch packet and starting corresponding services.
This functionality is needed for OVS-incompatible plugins, like Contrail.

Change-Id: I4457225e1fd7cac4b7ccc75ae94d5c5256027b87
Closes-bug: #1511809

subject: Restrucutre gate scripts
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-11-05 11:02:07.000000000', 'files': ['tests/setup_deploy.sh', 'tests/deploy_aio.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Restrucutre gate scripts

So we can respect DRY and share as much code as possible I have broken
out the common code between the aio and multinode gate scripts.

Additionally, this lays the ground work for removing our policy on
root-everywhere by using sudo. Once we get the non-root stuff worked
out we can gate as non-root user.

Change-Id: I781c597ab10f2296b95f51ae27e0fa617ffe0a66
Partially-Implements: blueprint multinode-gate
'}]
commit_message:
Restrucutre gate scripts

So we can respect DRY and share as much code as possible I have broken
out the common code between the aio and multinode gate scripts.

Additionally, this lays the ground work for removing our policy on
root-everywhere by using sudo. Once we get the non-root stuff worked
out we can gate as non-root user.

Change-Id: I781c597ab10f2296b95f51ae27e0fa617ffe0a66
Partially-Implements: blueprint multinode-gate

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-23 18:45:52.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/account/test_reaper.py', 'test/unit/cli/test_recon.py', 'test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_dlo.py', 'test/unit/common/test_wsgi.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_reconstructor.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_tempauth.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_slo.py', 'test/unit/container/test_sync.py', 'test/unit/container/test_reconciler.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_ssync_receiver.py'], 'message': "Get rid of contextlib.nested() for py3

contextlib.nested() is missing completely in Python 3.

Since 2.7, we can use multiple context managers in a 'with' statement,
like so:

    with thing1() as t1, thing2() as t2:
        do_stuff()

Now, if we had some code that needed to nest an arbitrary number of
context managers, there's stuff we could do with contextlib.ExitStack
and such... but we don't. We only use contextlib.nested() in tests to
set up bunches of mocks without crazy-deep indentation, and all that
stuff fits perfectly into multiple-context-manager 'with' statements.

Change-Id: Id472958b007948f05dbd4c7fb8cf3ffab58e2681
"}]
commit_message:
Get rid of contextlib.nested() for py3

contextlib.nested() is missing completely in Python 3.

Since 2.7, we can use multiple context managers in a 'with' statement,
like so:

    with thing1() as t1, thing2() as t2:
        do_stuff()

Now, if we had some code that needed to nest an arbitrary number of
context managers, there's stuff we could do with contextlib.ExitStack
and such... but we don't. We only use contextlib.nested() in tests to
set up bunches of mocks without crazy-deep indentation, and all that
stuff fits perfectly into multiple-context-manager 'with' statements.

Change-Id: Id472958b007948f05dbd4c7fb8cf3ffab58e2681

Closes-Bug: #1507920

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-03 20:30:55.000000000', 'files': ['app/js/controllers/project.js', 'app/js/controllers/tests.js', 'app/views/tests.html', 'app/views/project.html', 'app/js/directives/table-sort.js'], 'message': 'Move table sorting functionality into dedicated directive.

This adds a new set of directives for table sorting functionality,
intended to greatly reduce the code needed to add the feature.
Sorting can now be added to any table by applying the new
`table-sort` directive, passing in a dataset, and mapping sort
fields to columns. Table output should instead use `table-ref`
to access a sorted array, but is otherwise fully compatible with
existing filter functionality.

Existing tables in project and tests views have also been updated
to make use of this new directive.

Change-Id: Ie3fd082008b21087d135363e302cc62703a1284a
'}]
commit_message:
Move table sorting functionality into dedicated directive.

This adds a new set of directives for table sorting functionality,
intended to greatly reduce the code needed to add the feature.
Sorting can now be added to any table by applying the new
`table-sort` directive, passing in a dataset, and mapping sort
fields to columns. Table output should instead use `table-ref`
to access a sorted array, but is otherwise fully compatible with
existing filter functionality.

Existing tables in project and tests views have also been updated
to make use of this new directive.

Change-Id: Ie3fd082008b21087d135363e302cc62703a1284a

commit_message:
Validate arguments for command rally verify compare

Running 'rally verify compare' command, if uuid is empty, it will
gives a unfriendly message.

This patch validate uuid agrument, and raise a friendly message
when meets an exception.

Closes-Bug: #1512707
Change-Id: I746ce5b436d5bc8ae54af64ffe8026a33a10ee1f

commit_message:
Serialize net roles depends on deployment tasks

This changes adds:
 * class AllocateVIPs80Mixin
 * method to get enabled node roles in cluster
 * method to get enabled network roles in cluster

VIPs and network roles should serialize depends on enabled
deployment tasks

Implements: blueprint fuel-integrate-ironic (partially)

Change-Id: I49879ba2bc87b9ebc0dd20742a8ff1db314692b9

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-04 18:45:17.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/usage/quotas.py'], 'message': 'Use sum of volumes and snapshots for cinder usage

The cinder quota on gigabytes is the sum of both volumes and snapshots,
therefore in the horizon view we should be representing usage as the
combination of volumes and snapshots, otherwise users will be confused
when getting quota errors on volume or snapshot creation.

Closes-Bug: 1513179
Change-Id: Id23e0dd3a3f810e75f9013cecbf8a826c97e34c6
'}]
commit_message:
Use sum of volumes and snapshots for cinder usage

The cinder quota on gigabytes is the sum of both volumes and snapshots,
therefore in the horizon view we should be representing usage as the
combination of volumes and snapshots, otherwise users will be confused
when getting quota errors on volume or snapshot creation.

Closes-Bug: 1513179
Change-Id: Id23e0dd3a3f810e75f9013cecbf8a826c97e34c6

This change updates and cleans up our alembic migration code:
- we now use an alembic migration entry point, instead of shipping
  our own db management tool
- use expand/contract alembic branches
- downgrade is not supported anymore, and we had none, drop it

To allow testing the migration scripts, Neutron is added
as a dependency for tests (in way that avoids cloning the neutron repo
for each test run)

Change-Id: Ib122895e0a5b07eb1e7b1ec04233c49e95389476
'}]
commit_message:
Alembic update/cleanup

This change updates and cleans up our alembic migration code:
- we now use an alembic migration entry point, instead of shipping
  our own db management tool
- use expand/contract alembic branches
- downgrade is not supported anymore, and we had none, drop it

To allow testing the migration scripts, Neutron is added
as a dependency for tests (in way that avoids cloning the neutron repo
for each test run)

Change-Id: Ib122895e0a5b07eb1e7b1ec04233c49e95389476

commit_message:
Remove dashes from short tar params

Using dashes with tar's short parameters creates a bunch of extra logging
output and warnings.  This should greatly reduce logging output.

Change-Id: Icf9392c749e3f9731e5bc182a242a2bc11e440a9
(cherry picked from commit d6930f1b04ce664af009263c6b9e80fc01102908)

commit_message:
Missing Open iSCSI daemon on compute hosts to use Cinder LUNs

Compute hosts need open-iscsi/iscsid container to attach to
remote luns if one boots from iscsi volume or attach it later
This commit only deals with client side iscsi.

Change-Id: I9ed18183d577e7e7764932515d9ba953127a5074
Closes-Bug: #1511699

subject: Comparision opeartor has been changed.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-03 04:53:00.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/engine/policies.py'], 'message': "Comparision opeartor has been changed.

While creating policy '>' operator is used,
due to which in py34 exception is occurred when
variable is provided from input parameter.

Exception was
TypeError: unorderable types: str() > int()

TODO: Add more unit test to catch such scenarios.

Partially-Implements: blueprint mistral-py3
Change-Id: I2c652812ae4a04cd7610f2a6684da76c582a4e32
"}]
commit_message:
Comparision opeartor has been changed.

While creating policy '>' operator is used,
due to which in py34 exception is occurred when
variable is provided from input parameter.

Exception was
TypeError: unorderable types: str() > int()

TODO: Add more unit test to catch such scenarios.

Partially-Implements: blueprint mistral-py3
Change-Id: I2c652812ae4a04cd7610f2a6684da76c582a4e32

admin netwoks configuration of any nodegroup we have in Fuel:

  in mcollective container

commit_message:
Dynamic dnsmasq config for admin network ranges

In order to successfully PXE/boot nodes from new racks we need to update
cobbler's dnsmasq configuration on changes in admin networks of any
nodegroup in any Fuel environment. Such changes should survive cobbler
container restarts and rebuilds.

In order to do so we need to execute the following on every change in
admin netwoks configuration of any nodegroup we have in Fuel:
- dump list of admin networks into /etc/hiera/networks.yaml file
  in mcollective container
- run 'puppet apply nailgin/examples/dhcp-ranges.pp' inside mcollective
  container to update config files in shared /etc/dnsmasq.d/ dir
- run 'cobbler sync' inside cobbler container to reload dnsmasq

Co-Authored-By: Aleksandr Didenko <adidenko@mirantis.com>

Blueprint: dynamic-dnsmasq
Partial-bug: #1495593
Change-Id: I9d7428c9fc21c705a1aee7fbca8003829a81e1d0

commit_message:
Fix dependency for Ceilometer agent when using MySQL

In HA, when using MySQL as a backend for Ceilometer, the dependencies
set for the Ceilometer central agent depended always on MongoDB; Which
should only be the case if MongoDB is set as a backend.

Change-Id: I6fecfe0564b13e9352313c5a3492505b44d12eaa

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}, {'_account_id': 11748, 'name': 'Chris St. Pierre', 'email': 'cstpierr@cisco.com', 'username': 'stpierre'}, {'_account_id': 12395, 'name': 'Roman Vasylets', 'email': 'pomeo92@gmail.com', 'username': 'rvasilets'}, {'_account_id': 14817, 'name': 'Mirantis Rally CI', 'email': 'rally-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ci50'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-04 18:22:00.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_ddt.py', 'tests/unit/test_test_ddt.py'], 'message': "Add AST checker for missing @ddt.ddt decorators

If a test case class has functions decorated with a ddt decorator, but
is not itself decorated with @ddt.ddt, then tests don't run
properly. This adds an AST checker to ensure that a class that
contains functions decorated with a ddt decorator is properly
decorated. It also includes unit tests for the checker itself.

Change-Id: If7186d1f8b9a1967e7af55d86cd568e323aeccf7
"}]
commit_message:
Add AST checker for missing @ddt.ddt decorators

If a test case class has functions decorated with a ddt decorator, but
is not itself decorated with @ddt.ddt, then tests don't run
properly. This adds an AST checker to ensure that a class that
contains functions decorated with a ddt decorator is properly
decorated. It also includes unit tests for the checker itself.

Change-Id: If7186d1f8b9a1967e7af55d86cd568e323aeccf7

commit_message:
Remove ineffective assignment in subcommand

No need to assign return value to $rc in subcommand,
value in subcommand can not pass to parent process, plus,
it is never used.

Change-Id: I5f478813c7472d3709e09ff88f2165d5f1cd9097
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Wrapper is used instead of direct json library.

jsonutils library is wrapper for json library.
Also it has taken care of py27 and py34 compatibility.

Apart from this json.dumps() has diffrent behaviour
in py27 and py34. It add extra space in py27 but not
in py34.

Partially-Implements: blueprint mistral-py3
Change-Id: I7e4754e7e695ad6a327cd54ecd47e8434978cd27

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-02 14:18:00.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/ipam_pluggable_backend.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_ipam_pluggable_backend.py'], 'message': "Fix incorrect passing port dict in pluggable IPAM

_ipam_allocate_ips expects to receive port dict as a third argument, but
'changes' were passed instead.

This issue affects only third-party vendors who implement own IPAM
driver with custom AddressRequestFactory and uses port dict in it.

Updated arguments passed to _ipam_allocate_ips to include port dict as a
third argument.

Change-Id: I25eb86f46e5412cfacad9a751a94f7720f1a7bd0
Closes-Bug: #1511707
"}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect passing port dict in pluggable IPAM

_ipam_allocate_ips expects to receive port dict as a third argument, but
'changes' were passed instead.

This issue affects only third-party vendors who implement own IPAM
driver with custom AddressRequestFactory and uses port dict in it.

Updated arguments passed to _ipam_allocate_ips to include port dict as a
third argument.

Change-Id: I25eb86f46e5412cfacad9a751a94f7720f1a7bd0
Closes-Bug: #1511707

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-03 09:38:44.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/openstack/smaug.config', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'gerrit/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Add new repo for Smaug

Application Data Protection as a Service for OpenStack
Our mission statement is:
* Formalize Application Data Protection in OpenStack (APIs, Services,
Plugins, …)
* Be able to protect Any Resource in OpenStack (as well as their dependencies)
* Allow Diversity of vendor solutions, capabilities and implementations
without compromising usability

* Open Architecture
** Vendors create plugins that implement Protection mechanisms for different
OpenStack resources
* User perspective: Protect App Deployment
** Configure and manage custom protection plans on the deployed resources
(topology, VMs, volumes, images, …)
* Admin perspective: Define Protectable Resources
** Decide what plugins protect which resources, what is available for the user
** Decide where users can protect their resources

Change-Id: Ic104634b7cf49c9a3e07b16d5faada248f5b1789
'}]
commit_message:
Add new repo for Smaug

Application Data Protection as a Service for OpenStack
Our mission statement is:
* Formalize Application Data Protection in OpenStack (APIs, Services,
Plugins, …)
* Be able to protect Any Resource in OpenStack (as well as their dependencies)
* Allow Diversity of vendor solutions, capabilities and implementations
without compromising usability

* Open Architecture
** Vendors create plugins that implement Protection mechanisms for different
OpenStack resources
* User perspective: Protect App Deployment
** Configure and manage custom protection plans on the deployed resources
(topology, VMs, volumes, images, …)
* Admin perspective: Define Protectable Resources
** Decide what plugins protect which resources, what is available for the user
** Decide where users can protect their resources

Change-Id: Ic104634b7cf49c9a3e07b16d5faada248f5b1789

subject: Add functional test for access control (OPTIONS INFO) with Keystone
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-18 01:32:24.000000000', 'files': ['test/functional/test_xaccess_control.py'], 'message': 'Add functional test for access control (OPTIONS INFO) with Keystone

This patch adds the following cases (OPTIONS INFO):
http://paste.openstack.org/show/407407/

These cases are created using Orthogonal array testing technique with
the following procedure in order to gurantee the coverage.
* dump all parameters and thier values for the access control test
  http://paste.openstack.org/show/406876/
* create cases, combinations above parameters and values, then map to
  the test schema for functional test
  http://paste.openstack.org/show/406878/
* summarize the cases
  Table A * Table B
* split to several scenarios from the summarized cases using http method
  (GET, HEAD and OPTIONS)

user information: http://paste.openstack.org/show/405097/

Change-Id: I726e55ddb04662226d7374f7172c728d8881d271
'}]
commit_message:
Add functional test for access control (OPTIONS INFO) with Keystone

This patch adds the following cases (OPTIONS INFO):
http://paste.openstack.org/show/407407/

These cases are created using Orthogonal array testing technique with
the following procedure in order to gurantee the coverage.
* dump all parameters and thier values for the access control test
  http://paste.openstack.org/show/406876/
* create cases, combinations above parameters and values, then map to
  the test schema for functional test
  http://paste.openstack.org/show/406878/
* summarize the cases
  Table A * Table B
* split to several scenarios from the summarized cases using http method
  (GET, HEAD and OPTIONS)

user information: http://paste.openstack.org/show/405097/

Change-Id: I726e55ddb04662226d7374f7172c728d8881d271

subject: Restrict account_autocreate behavior with allow_account_management
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-06 04:25:04.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/container.py'], 'message': 'Restrict account_autocreate behavior with allow_account_management

allow_account_management in proxy-server.conf is used for controlling
account creation and deletion.
If allow_account_management is false (default), nobody can create/delete
accounts.
But if account_autocreate in proxy-server.conf is true and then put
container comes to proxy servers, an account will be created.

This patch restricts the behavior.

Change-Id: I82b0a5e5fd20ae8b28497139a543f8b480769f7a
Closes-Bug: #1482041
'}]
commit_message:
Restrict account_autocreate behavior with allow_account_management

allow_account_management in proxy-server.conf is used for controlling
account creation and deletion.
If allow_account_management is false (default), nobody can create/delete
accounts.
But if account_autocreate in proxy-server.conf is true and then put
container comes to proxy servers, an account will be created.

This patch restricts the behavior.

Change-Id: I82b0a5e5fd20ae8b28497139a543f8b480769f7a
Closes-Bug: #1482041

the following procedure in order to gurantee the coverage.
* dump all parameters and thier values for the access control test
  http://paste.openstack.org/show/405142/
* create cases, combinations above parameters and values, then map to
  the test schema for functional test
  http://paste.openstack.org/show/405130/
* summarize the cases
  Table A * Table B * (No.1 to No.4 in Table C) +
  Table A * (No.1 in Table B) * (No.6, No.11-12, No.15-16, No.21,
  No.26-27, No.30 in Table C)
* split to several scenarios from the summarized cases using http method
  such as PUT, GET and so on for easier review
user information: http://paste.openstack.org/show/405097/

Change-Id: Ia7e474641692aa4277bf70169e04ee32b5f5ccea
'}]
commit_message:
Add functional test for access control (GET) with Keystone

This patch adds the following cases:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/383524/

These cases are created using Orthogonal array testing technique with
the following procedure in order to gurantee the coverage.
* dump all parameters and thier values for the access control test
  http://paste.openstack.org/show/405142/
* create cases, combinations above parameters and values, then map to
  the test schema for functional test
  http://paste.openstack.org/show/405130/
* summarize the cases
  Table A * Table B * (No.1 to No.4 in Table C) +
  Table A * (No.1 in Table B) * (No.6, No.11-12, No.15-16, No.21,
  No.26-27, No.30 in Table C)
* split to several scenarios from the summarized cases using http method
  such as PUT, GET and so on for easier review
user information: http://paste.openstack.org/show/405097/

Change-Id: Ia7e474641692aa4277bf70169e04ee32b5f5ccea

commit_message:
Detection plugin for Barbican service

Detects Barbican daemons and setup configuration for monitoring. Default
values for service_api_url, process_names and search_pattern are
provided. Allows overriding the default values via the args parameter.

Updated 'service_name'  to 'key-manager'

Change-Id: Iadac18bcd700f5f7e1749b7a234fbb5438c56892

subject: Remove some unecessary text_type transforms
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-27 01:10:49.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/metering/tables.py', 'horizon/tabs/base.py', 'horizon/tables/base.py', 'openstack_dashboard/api/keystone.py'], 'message': 'Remove some unecessary text_type transforms

These uses of text_type:

py2: convert a str to unicode in situations where
the unicode will just be converted back to str by
Python (ie. attribute names or __str__ return
values) and if high-bit unicode was ever present
then Python would throw a UnicodeEncodeError when
unable to encode the unicode to ASCII.

py3: convert a str to str (ie. a no-op)

Also removed a test for text.slugify (our minimum
Django version always has it) and the unnecessary
text_type call there too.

Change-Id: I529be1ac09581548a8aca604c55ab96637bcc737
'}]
commit_message:
Remove some unecessary text_type transforms

These uses of text_type:

py2: convert a str to unicode in situations where
the unicode will just be converted back to str by
Python (ie. attribute names or __str__ return
values) and if high-bit unicode was ever present
then Python would throw a UnicodeEncodeError when
unable to encode the unicode to ASCII.

py3: convert a str to str (ie. a no-op)

Also removed a test for text.slugify (our minimum
Django version always has it) and the unnecessary
text_type call there too.

Change-Id: I529be1ac09581548a8aca604c55ab96637bcc737

commit_message:
Make sure dashboard has a default panel group

According to the Horizon documentation for Settings and Configuration,
for a plugin panel, 'If you want the panel to show up without a panel
group, use the panel group “default”'. In some cases, plugin panels were
getting put under the panel group "Other" instead. This is because
the default panel group wasn't getting created during plugin panel
processing when the panel's dashboard class already had some panel
groups defined. Fix this by making sure a default panel group is created
in each dashboard.

Change-Id: I98064c434326aabec16b5d1631e360643609ed40
Closes-Bug: 1403094

commit_message:
Add more informative error during parsing

If there is some error during parsing template or
env file, CSafeLoader errors doesn't contains snippet
from template. So, we need to use SafeLoader for more
informative error with snippet from parsed template.

Change-Id: I79039164533c032db66c933c4e8882b8942961eb
Related-bug: #1496361
(cherry picked from commit b41739a63ed915a763d9102865056ee540477917)

commit_message:
Allow get_attr: [res_name] format to get all attribute

Don't check None attribute name if want to get all
attributes of resource, and this only works in template
'2015-10-15' or higher version.

Change-Id: I6699bfc8bc8096e5dc313d01b3a829694c105fea
Closes-Bug: #1505560
(cherry picked from commit 1240c33a3ffc887378011e1d171036c575444ba0)

commit_message:
Do nothing in prepare_for_replace if port not created

There is no need to reset 'fixed_ips' for an non-existent
port when prepare for update replace.

Closes-Bug: #1509977
(cherry picked from commit 9ea7250f3daeb8e8cf8b9e7f3deea639569ab790)

Conflicts:
	heat/tests/neutron/test_neutron_port.py

Change-Id: I212e3ff73e41c6bffc5e76457d8e2aaf360f5ceb

commit_message:
Fix handling of FAILED ResourceGroup members on rolling update

Ensure that any members of a ResourceGroup that are in a FAILED state are
still included in the generated template during a rolling update, so that
Heat will replace them in the nested stack.

Change-Id: I1806d3160c364b0942934eb8b43614f17b98bacb
Closes-Bug: #1508736
(cherry picked from commit c56c326c1fea06994a751147f94144763eb324c7)

commit_message:
Remove 'mkdir cloud-01 && cd cloud-01 && tempest init'

In tempest's readme doc,it tells 'tempest init cloud-01' works the
same as 'mkdir cloud-01 && cd cloud-01 && tempest init'.But since
change I960bc711ff78ac2b0441ef63dff8ec4fb268fd3a,we can't use a
existed directory to initialize a tempest environment.The readme doc
has not been updated yet.
Also change some sentences to help understand.

Change-Id: I0e3e681732f73a2f45aafc9752e1b00ef944c2ad
Closes-Bug: #1512628

subject: make project_id optional in urls for version discovery
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 5754, 'name': 'Alex Xu', 'email': 'hejie.xu@intel.com', 'username': 'xuhj'}, {'_account_id': 6062, 'name': 'jichenjc', 'email': 'jichenjc@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'jichenjc'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 17714, 'name': 'Augustina Ragwitz', 'email': 'auggy@cpan.org', 'username': 'mmmpork'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2015-10-22 18:11:06.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/unit/v2/fakes.py', 'novaclient/v2/versions.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_versions.py'], 'message': 'make project_id optional in urls for version discovery

Currently there is a baked in assumption throughout the nova ecosystem
that endpoint urls will end in {project_id}.

This means that the version document for a specific major API version
is "endpoint - last_chunk_of_url". This is not a discoverable URL,
it's one that we heuristically generate.

GET /v2.1/{project_id} is a 404.

If we make Nova able to handle endpoint ids without {project_id} we
run into a problem with novaclient, which is that end_point is now
/v2.1. The heuristic gives us a version url of /. Which returns a very
different doc than /v2.1. This causes all novaclient commands to explode.

In order to support this transition we need to make both Nova and
Novaclient handle endpoints with and without {project_id}.

The proposal is thus to try the raw value of the endpoint first. If it
works, great. If it fails with a 404, fall back to the heuristics.

While this change and the nova change are technically independent, we
should land this one as soon as possible, because clients before this
change will not work with Nova deploys that get rid of project_id in
their service catalog in the future.

Part of bp:service-catalog-tng

Co-Authored-By: Augustina Ragwitz <aragwitz+lp@pobox.com>
Change-Id: Id4a2f73cbcfcf36aea750375fd92b1c2d3cd824e
'}]
commit_message:
make project_id optional in urls for version discovery

Currently there is a baked in assumption throughout the nova ecosystem
that endpoint urls will end in {project_id}.

This means that the version document for a specific major API version
is "endpoint - last_chunk_of_url". This is not a discoverable URL,
it's one that we heuristically generate.

GET /v2.1/{project_id} is a 404.

If we make Nova able to handle endpoint ids without {project_id} we
run into a problem with novaclient, which is that end_point is now
/v2.1. The heuristic gives us a version url of /. Which returns a very
different doc than /v2.1. This causes all novaclient commands to explode.

In order to support this transition we need to make both Nova and
Novaclient handle endpoints with and without {project_id}.

The proposal is thus to try the raw value of the endpoint first. If it
works, great. If it fails with a 404, fall back to the heuristics.

While this change and the nova change are technically independent, we
should land this one as soon as possible, because clients before this
change will not work with Nova deploys that get rid of project_id in
their service catalog in the future.

Part of bp:service-catalog-tng

Co-Authored-By: Augustina Ragwitz <aragwitz+lp@pobox.com>
Change-Id: Id4a2f73cbcfcf36aea750375fd92b1c2d3cd824e

subject: Fix uniqueness check of initrd in fedora-minimal
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6488, 'name': 'Clint Byrum', 'email': 'clint@fewbar.com', 'username': 'clint-fewbar'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 9369, 'name': 'Steve Kowalik', 'email': 'steven@wedontsleep.org', 'username': 'stevenk'}, {'_account_id': 10035, 'name': 'greghaynes', 'email': 'greg@greghaynes.net', 'username': 'greghaynes'}, {'_account_id': 13039, 'name': 'Martin André', 'email': 'm.andre@redhat.com', 'username': 'mandre'}, {'_account_id': 16272, 'name': 'Clint Adams', 'email': 'clint@gcfm.net', 'username': 'clint'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-03 19:25:06.000000000', 'files': ['elements/fedora-minimal/install.d/99-ramdisk'], 'message': "Fix uniqueness check of initrd in fedora-minimal

The check suffered from various flaws.

First, due to missing quotes around $initrd, 'wc -l' would always see
1 line no matter how many results the find returned.

Second, echo adds a line break making 'wc -l' count 1 even for empty
string. We need to add a check for empty string.

Change-Id: Ib2c67960f566dbdc471d9585a4cef1beb1cc38ab
Closes-Bug: #1506692
"}]
commit_message:
Fix uniqueness check of initrd in fedora-minimal

The check suffered from various flaws.

First, due to missing quotes around $initrd, 'wc -l' would always see
1 line no matter how many results the find returned.

Second, echo adds a line break making 'wc -l' count 1 even for empty
string. We need to add a check for empty string.

Change-Id: Ib2c67960f566dbdc471d9585a4cef1beb1cc38ab
Closes-Bug: #1506692
