commit_message:
libvirt: implement get_device_name_for_instance

We implement the method above with the purpose of using the
nova.libvirt.blockinfo primitives (which match how libvirt itself works),
to decide on which device name to use for an instance.

With this change - we will be using the libvirt local logic to decide on
the volume device name instead of relying on
nova.compute.utils.get_device_name_for_instance() which will do wrong
things in a number of cases.

Closes-bug: 1452224
Related-bug: 1231874

Change-Id: I33d7363c018fc4e5e9f190486d5556363852badb
(cherry picked from commit c5db407bb22e453a4bca22de1860bb6ce6090782)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-30 20:37:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: Always default device names at boot

Up until now, libvirt would default it's own device names unless they
were specified by the user at boot. This could lead to inconsistencies,
so the soft approach was to discourage users from passing in explicit
device names, by documenting the fact that they will not be honoured,
 but not override them.

It turns out that this approach causes more trouble, especially when we
add attaching volumes into the mix. So the approach now is to make
libvirt _always_ override what is passed in. That way even if the user
specifies a device name, the attach will not fail due to a device name
collision (a common problem - see related bug), and Nova book keeping
will match what we can see in the instance on most OSes.

In order to get there we now make sure boot starts acting like that
before we switch attach_volume over too, so that there is consistent
behavior.

Also - make tests for defaulting device names more realistic as they now
actually run the code instead of just making sure the right methods get
called.

UpgradeImpact: After this commit, supplying a device name for any of
the block devices specified as part of the `nova boot` call will not be
honoured by any libvirt compute nodes.

Change-Id: I76a7cfd995db6c04f7af48ff8c9acdd55750ed76
Related-bug: #1075971
(cherry picked from commit 0283234e837d9faf807e6e8da6ec6321ee56b31a)
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Always default device names at boot

Up until now, libvirt would default it's own device names unless they
were specified by the user at boot. This could lead to inconsistencies,
so the soft approach was to discourage users from passing in explicit
device names, by documenting the fact that they will not be honoured,
 but not override them.

It turns out that this approach causes more trouble, especially when we
add attaching volumes into the mix. So the approach now is to make
libvirt _always_ override what is passed in. That way even if the user
specifies a device name, the attach will not fail due to a device name
collision (a common problem - see related bug), and Nova book keeping
will match what we can see in the instance on most OSes.

In order to get there we now make sure boot starts acting like that
before we switch attach_volume over too, so that there is consistent
behavior.

Also - make tests for defaulting device names more realistic as they now
actually run the code instead of just making sure the right methods get
called.

UpgradeImpact: After this commit, supplying a device name for any of
the block devices specified as part of the `nova boot` call will not be
honoured by any libvirt compute nodes.

Change-Id: I76a7cfd995db6c04f7af48ff8c9acdd55750ed76
Related-bug: #1075971
(cherry picked from commit 0283234e837d9faf807e6e8da6ec6321ee56b31a)

commit_message:
virt: add get_device_name_for_instance to the base driver class

Just as libvirt needs to decide on the device names when booting an
instance (as opposed to them being assigned by the user), the same needs
to be done when attaching additional volumes to a running instance.

This patch exposes it on the ComputeDriver base class and makes sure
that it will be called by the compute manager (and that an appropriate
fallback will happen if the drivers do not care about overriding this),
as a pre-req for doing the work in the libvirt driver.

Partial-bug: 1452224
Related-bug: 1231874

Conflicts:
        nova/compute/manager.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to 91b35b22e dropping compute RPC
3.x support in Liberty where return_bdm_object was dropped from the
reserve_block_device_name method.

Change-Id: I66693a8a6a632b65f930a58905336397ac6c9f29
(cherry picked from commit b6733dbdf3d04f4e334f1aeb6ee7ce4b6d1b7b95)

commit_message:
libvirt: make default_device_names DRY-er

Since we now have a reusable method to call to get the block_device_info
structure that most driver code is designed to work with, we don't need
to re-write it in the blockinfo code - we can just use it.

In addition to this - this fixes a (yet unreported) issue that libvirt
would not consider blank volumes in it's device assignments.

Related-bug: 1231874
Partial-bug: 1452224

Change-Id: I4b9a6fd1b08ff787fdd1226f533f4181fe44b7e9
(cherry picked from commit fb3d3773a2c2b07af2849608f1481c9f37a9ec62)

commit_message:
virt: Move building the block_device_info dict into a method

The block_device_info structure is needed in several places, so it's
useful to move it into a method and remove the code repetition that is
all over the place.

Also make sure there is a single way to get the legacy dict format for
the drivers that need this (however at this point we should probably
remove that soon, and convert all the in-tree drivers to expect the new
format).

Related-bug: 1231874
Partial-bug: 1452224

Change-Id: I608042c58c04f333f6fbb8d9824eb8f3913c6310
(cherry picked from commit 94a5793d63a797697fb1f937340cb49b3c7e9787)

subject: virt: make sure convert_all_volumes catches blank volumes too
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-30 20:37:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/test_block_device.py', 'nova/virt/block_device.py'], 'message': 'virt: make sure convert_all_volumes catches blank volumes too

convert_all_volumes would skip over blanks. This patch makes sure it
will consider them now too.

The patch (42ea00ee) that introduces the method for some reason
completely missed the Blank volume type.

Closes-bug: #1451950

commit_message:
virt: make sure convert_all_volumes catches blank volumes too

convert_all_volumes would skip over blanks. This patch makes sure it
will consider them now too.

The patch (42ea00ee) that introduces the method for some reason
completely missed the Blank volume type.

Closes-bug: #1451950

Change-Id: I146a9bb09c149db1bab6dc13c082b00e5de8b764
(cherry picked from commit 13ce6b5eff303fc544ba61ee19f66dbfabc6e20c)

commit_message:
compute utils: Remove a useless context parameter

get_device_name_for_instance used to require a context to be passed in
explicitly, but this is no longer required, so this patch removes it
from the signature.

Change-Id: I076c377199ce3d17541a772544dfb4d9bc4df2e9
(cherry picked from commit 51bdf76b501edae18b251adfa0163236455e15f5)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-04 20:50:27.000000000', 'files': ['vagrant/provisioning/setup-compute.sh', 'vagrant/provisioning/setup-base.sh', '.gitignore', 'vagrant/provisioning/setup-controller.sh', 'vagrant/provisioning/virtualbox.conf.yml', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'vagrant/Vagrantfile'], 'message': "Update Vagrant configuration to deploy 3-node OVN setup

This updates the Vagrant setup to deploy a 3-node Ubuntu Trusty
setup (1 control node, 2 compute nodes). The Vivid image this
was previously trying to download was HUGE, and it's not clear
why running on Vivid is better considering the gate uses
Trusty.

Also, adjust the names of the nodes this spawns to be a bit
more sane. They are now spawned as:

ovn-controller
ovn-compute1
ovn-compute2

One final change adds some additional configuration into
local.conf which allows this all to come up and run.

Closes-Bug: #1499917
Change-Id: Ife6cfbe18ea1053ca52b8ff0f074987c178a713c
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>

commit_message:
Update Vagrant configuration to deploy 3-node OVN setup

This updates the Vagrant setup to deploy a 3-node Ubuntu Trusty
setup (1 control node, 2 compute nodes). The Vivid image this
was previously trying to download was HUGE, and it's not clear
why running on Vivid is better considering the gate uses
Trusty.

Also, adjust the names of the nodes this spawns to be a bit
more sane. They are now spawned as:

ovn-controller
ovn-compute1
ovn-compute2

One final change adds some additional configuration into
local.conf which allows this all to come up and run.

Closes-Bug: #1499917
Change-Id: Ife6cfbe18ea1053ca52b8ff0f074987c178a713c
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-03 20:59:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/cells/messaging.py'], 'message': "cells: add debug logging to bdm_update_or_create_at_top

The method is racy and we need to know which conditions we're hitting
when we fail, which is happening sometimes with the
test_create_ebs_image_and_check_boot test in Tempest.

We fail because the image snapshot metadata has duplicate BDM entries in
it so that when we boot an instance from that image, there are multiple
BDMs with the same boot_index and nova.compute.api.API._validate_bdm
throws up.

Related-Bug: #1489581

Change-Id: I8058e0c16e0fd9b54d4a46e86e0fdede3da55777
"}]
commit_message:
cells: add debug logging to bdm_update_or_create_at_top

The method is racy and we need to know which conditions we're hitting
when we fail, which is happening sometimes with the
test_create_ebs_image_and_check_boot test in Tempest.

We fail because the image snapshot metadata has duplicate BDM entries in
it so that when we boot an instance from that image, there are multiple
BDMs with the same boot_index and nova.compute.api.API._validate_bdm
throws up.

Related-Bug: #1489581

Change-Id: I8058e0c16e0fd9b54d4a46e86e0fdede3da55777

commit_message:
Remove kube-register

kubelet has already the ablitity to register node with --register-node
option which defaults to true if --api-server is set [1], so we don't
need kube-register now.

Change-Id: I5899e3a457e799fac42593f82ce69d0def593d43
Closes-Bug: #1511281

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-04 22:05:10.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_ovs_lib.py'], 'message': 'Handle empty bridge case in OVSBridge.get_ports_attributes

Before this patch, get_ports_attributes would call
get_port_name_list. In the case of an empty bridge,
get_port_name_list would return an empty list and feed that
in to ovsdb.db_list, thereby returning all ports instead of
no ports.

Closes-Bug: #1499821
(cherry picked from commit 9c3e3a0fcee012ee0187b19931d63927379a621f)

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_ovs_lib.py

Change-Id: I5a91028c59d71943b7cef86a94fa6ab1cc3d667c
'}]
commit_message:
Handle empty bridge case in OVSBridge.get_ports_attributes

Before this patch, get_ports_attributes would call
get_port_name_list. In the case of an empty bridge,
get_port_name_list would return an empty list and feed that
in to ovsdb.db_list, thereby returning all ports instead of
no ports.

Closes-Bug: #1499821
(cherry picked from commit 9c3e3a0fcee012ee0187b19931d63927379a621f)

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_ovs_lib.py

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-29 23:26:38.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/libvirt.py', 'monasca_agent/common/util.py'], 'message': "Allow config file 'instances' to be empty

This change allows slightly more lenient processing of Agent config
files, where 'instances' is still required in the .yaml file, but may
be an empty list.

An example of where this is necessary is the libvirt plugin, where
it is unreasonable to have all VMs enumerated as 'instances' in the
.yaml file, but are instead provided by the hypervisor.

The libvirt plugin itself needed a minor modification to work with
empty instances.  These changes are necessitated by the monasca-setup
change https://review.openstack.org/239815

Change-Id: Idc67df9e5d9195f65fe16b9d67478e1de8e61eb3
"}]
commit_message:
Allow config file 'instances' to be empty

This change allows slightly more lenient processing of Agent config
files, where 'instances' is still required in the .yaml file, but may
be an empty list.

An example of where this is necessary is the libvirt plugin, where
it is unreasonable to have all VMs enumerated as 'instances' in the
.yaml file, but are instead provided by the hypervisor.

The libvirt plugin itself needed a minor modification to work with
empty instances.  These changes are necessitated by the monasca-setup
change https://review.openstack.org/239815

Change-Id: Idc67df9e5d9195f65fe16b9d67478e1de8e61eb3

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-04 08:40:44.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/source/glance-install.rst'], 'message': 'no finalize step for glance in Debian

There's no need to manually restart glance on Debian after installation
so this patch fixes this (removing the "Finalize installation" step

Change-Id: I4e2558fdf40da8d7361f96372079ea6efdbf8329

commit_message:
no finalize step for glance in Debian

There's no need to manually restart glance on Debian after installation
so this patch fixes this (removing the "Finalize installation" step
completely from the Debian install-guide).

Change-Id: I4e2558fdf40da8d7361f96372079ea6efdbf8329

commit_message:
Revised client interface

This is an effort to make the interface exposed by senlinclient more
usable for other software. Eventually, all these logic will go to
either openstackclient or openstacksdk, but for now we keep it locally
to make things work.

Change-Id: I25fdb0f3bb224951256ccb0eeafa09e906195805

Now through 'join' containers will be able to connect to multiple
networks with an endpoint in each network. There is no 'service' abstraction
now.

subject: Combine k8s api tests into one
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-23 20:54:44.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/functional/test_k8s_python_client.py'], 'message': 'Combine k8s api tests into one

The functional gate will create a bay for each test. There are six
tests in TestKubernetesAPIs, so six bays are created. This is
unnecessary. We can create one bay and let all the k8s tests run on
that bay.

Change-Id: I0d7f2b9352e21761d55b739cc6f63b8eef3d7074
Closes-Bug: #1509538
'}]
commit_message:
Combine k8s api tests into one

The functional gate will create a bay for each test. There are six
tests in TestKubernetesAPIs, so six bays are created. This is
unnecessary. We can create one bay and let all the k8s tests run on
that bay.

Change-Id: I0d7f2b9352e21761d55b739cc6f63b8eef3d7074
Closes-Bug: #1509538

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-30 12:58:11.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr/schemata/endpoint_create.py'], 'message': 'Make Interface information optional

Create endpoint may or may not contain information about one
or more interfaces. As is, the interface is required for creating
the endpoint by the schema. This fix allows for the case where no
interface is specified by removing Interfaces from the required
list.

Change-Id: I7dafd1d0dfda23ebefa07a8cec3d6db9a4270194
Partial-Bug: #1499779
'}]
commit_message:
Make Interface information optional

Create endpoint may or may not contain information about one
or more interfaces. As is, the interface is required for creating
the endpoint by the schema. This fix allows for the case where no
interface is specified by removing Interfaces from the required
list.

Change-Id: I7dafd1d0dfda23ebefa07a8cec3d6db9a4270194
Partial-Bug: #1499779

commit_message:
Refactor status and admin state translation code

In some of the dashboard 'views.py' files, there is code that enables
the detail status and, when applicable, admin state labels to be
translated.  The current coding style of these sections is hard
to read.  Any and all sections of code that use this style should
be refactored to enhance the code readability.  This change
proposes to create a single utility method that handles this
repetitive code block that is used in many places.  Thus to perform
the translation label lookup, this method need only be called.  This
method will provide a single clean and consistent code block that can
be used for any of these situations in the future.

Change-Id: I6353abef58fc2a481d4379eb1a2f8289d7f1790b
Closes-Bug: #1490031

subject: Revert "warm pip wheel cache during image build"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-04 20:40:46.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/cache-devstack/install.d/60-pip-warm-cache'], 'message': 'Revert "warm pip wheel cache during image build"

Turns out we can't do this without dirtying our images by
preinstalling all the libraries/headers our requirements want to
link against. We should revisit the wheel mirror solution which has
already been written as a saner solution.

This reverts commit 1503ef327817bd42cbf888e773f5639e660169a7.

Change-Id: I69ea73b6eb4b620f1ac77467ee3784ec3c813ee2
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "warm pip wheel cache during image build"

Turns out we can't do this without dirtying our images by
preinstalling all the libraries/headers our requirements want to
link against. We should revisit the wheel mirror solution which has
already been written as a saner solution.

This reverts commit 1503ef327817bd42cbf888e773f5639e660169a7.

Change-Id: I69ea73b6eb4b620f1ac77467ee3784ec3c813ee2

commit_message:
Factorize field definition of declarative code

Currently we have three differents parts of code that parse samples
and notifications. All of them do the same thing.
The event one have some additionals feature "TraitPlugin".

This change removes the code duplication and allows to use TraitPlugin
into gnocchi and meter definitions.

Change-Id: Id125de92a5893d7afa5a3d55c3f183bd2035a733

commit_message:
use assertIs(Not)None instead of assert(Not)Equal

Instead of using assert(Not)Equal(None, ***), developers should
use assertIs(Not)None(***). This patch fixes the same in LBaaS.

Change-Id: Ib29dc2c75b84977c4443b80f940331a572e5ec1d
Related-Bug: #1503055

subject: mitaka: release python-novaclient 2.34.0
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-29 14:02:18.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/mitaka/python-novaclient.yaml'], 'message': 'mitaka: release python-novaclient 2.34.0

Where to start...

6bda37f498f5ecb262dbb5d27c3f1ff8a47369d8 requested 2.33.0 which we
needed to get 28bf8dd released.

The 2.33.0 tag is on a5363ae0d60d41feff23f6cca44fcd7aa9fc5b8b so we
wouldn't pick up 0cd5812 which removes the novaclient.v1_1 module and is
a backward incompatible change.

However, 2.33.0 contained 2961e82 which was also a backward incompatible
change, which was reverted with 63c7a57.

2.33.0 has been blacklisted from global-requirements:

I6e7657b60308b30eed89b269810c1f37cce43063

Now we want to release a new version to include that revert. Note that
we reverted the removal of the novaclient.v1_1 module since that would
have also been a backward incompatible change. We reverted that so we
could release this as 2.34 with bug fixes. Once this is released we'll
redo the removal of the novaclient.v1_1 module and release that as
3.0.0.

Changes since 2.33.0:

mriedem@ubuntu:~/git/python-novaclient$ git log --oneline --no-merges
2.33.0..
036d42d Revert "Remove novaclient.v1_1 module"
63c7a57 Revert "Do not expose exceptions from requests library"
217e7c1 Updated from global requirements
0cd5812 Remove novaclient.v1_1 module

Related-Bug: #1510790

Change-Id: I4fc044e518a5cc5ea7b309a2824984a7035945bd
'}]
commit_message:
mitaka: release python-novaclient 2.34.0

Where to start...

6bda37f498f5ecb262dbb5d27c3f1ff8a47369d8 requested 2.33.0 which we
needed to get 28bf8dd released.

The 2.33.0 tag is on a5363ae0d60d41feff23f6cca44fcd7aa9fc5b8b so we
wouldn't pick up 0cd5812 which removes the novaclient.v1_1 module and is
a backward incompatible change.

However, 2.33.0 contained 2961e82 which was also a backward incompatible
change, which was reverted with 63c7a57.

2.33.0 has been blacklisted from global-requirements:

I6e7657b60308b30eed89b269810c1f37cce43063

Now we want to release a new version to include that revert. Note that
we reverted the removal of the novaclient.v1_1 module since that would
have also been a backward incompatible change. We reverted that so we
could release this as 2.34 with bug fixes. Once this is released we'll
redo the removal of the novaclient.v1_1 module and release that as
3.0.0.

Changes since 2.33.0:

mriedem@ubuntu:~/git/python-novaclient$ git log --oneline --no-merges
2.33.0..
036d42d Revert "Remove novaclient.v1_1 module"
63c7a57 Revert "Do not expose exceptions from requests library"
217e7c1 Updated from global requirements
0cd5812 Remove novaclient.v1_1 module

Related-Bug: #1510790

Change-Id: I4fc044e518a5cc5ea7b309a2824984a7035945bd

message to be after Mitaka so that external plugins will have
some grace period to clean up their code.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1926, 'name': 'Derek Higgins', 'email': 'derekh@redhat.com', 'username': 'derekh'}, {'_account_id': 2475, 'name': 'Antoine Musso', 'email': 'hashar@free.fr', 'username': 'hashar'}, {'_account_id': 4190, 'name': 'lifeless', 'email': 'robertc@robertcollins.net', 'username': 'lifeless'}, {'_account_id': 4330, 'name': 'Tomas Sedovic', 'email': 'tsedovic@redhat.com', 'username': 'tomas-8c8'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 9268, 'name': 'Gonéri Le Bouder', 'email': 'goneri@redhat.com', 'username': 'goneri'}, {'_account_id': 10035, 'name': 'greghaynes', 'email': 'greg@greghaynes.net', 'username': 'greghaynes'}, {'_account_id': 10290, 'name': 'Jonathan Brownell', 'email': 'cadenzajon@gmail.com', 'username': 'cadenzajon'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-30 21:41:14.000000000', 'files': ['elements/debian/install.d/10-cloud-opinions'], 'message': 'debian: cloud hostname ignored by Jessie

5af25b5f fixed the hostname of Debian images to "debian" since a lack of
hostname definition set the hostname to "(None)".

It has been done by introducing /etc/cloud/cloud.cfg.d/01_hostname.cfg
with content:

  hostname: debian

Review supposed the hostname would be overriden by cloud meta-data. That
might have stand true for Wheezy but it is not the case for Jessie.

cloud-init 0.7.6 ignores cloud metadata whenever "hostname" or "fqdn"
are set in a config file. Roughly:

    # no fqdn set, get fqdn from cloud
    # get hostname from cfg if available otherwise cloud
    fqdn = cloud.get_hostname(fqdn=True)
    if "hostname" in cfg:
        # hashar: set from config file NOT cloud
        hostname = cfg['hostname']
    else:
        # fallback to cloud
        hostname = cloud.get_hostname()

Relevant code is
https://github.com/number5/cloud-init/blob/0.7.6/cloudinit/util.py#L839-L860

Only inject "hostname: debian" for the Wheezy release.

Bug: https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T117283
Change-Id: I6e2522bd725cbf9651f11c76ecdc72ecbc92f402
'}]
commit_message:
debian: cloud hostname ignored by Jessie

5af25b5f fixed the hostname of Debian images to "debian" since a lack of
hostname definition set the hostname to "(None)".

It has been done by introducing /etc/cloud/cloud.cfg.d/01_hostname.cfg
with content:

  hostname: debian

Review supposed the hostname would be overriden by cloud meta-data. That
might have stand true for Wheezy but it is not the case for Jessie.

cloud-init 0.7.6 ignores cloud metadata whenever "hostname" or "fqdn"
are set in a config file. Roughly:

    # no fqdn set, get fqdn from cloud
    # get hostname from cfg if available otherwise cloud
    fqdn = cloud.get_hostname(fqdn=True)
    if "hostname" in cfg:
        # hashar: set from config file NOT cloud
        hostname = cfg['hostname']
    else:
        # fallback to cloud
        hostname = cloud.get_hostname()

Relevant code is
https://github.com/number5/cloud-init/blob/0.7.6/cloudinit/util.py#L839-L860

Only inject "hostname: debian" for the Wheezy release.

Bug: https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T117283
Change-Id: I6e2522bd725cbf9651f11c76ecdc72ecbc92f402

commit_message:
Fixes order of argument in assertEqual

argument order in assertEqual(observed, expected).
The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-03 02:49:30.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/tempest-jobs.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Ability to test oslo master libraries against liberty services

During the Tokyo summit discussions, there were concerns raised
about backward compatability guarantees with oslo libraries. The
main reason was that in liberty global-requirements we do not
cap the versions for oslo libraries and any oslo release in
support of mitaka is likely to break the stable/liberty branch.
We need to add additional jobs to make sure a change in oslo
library in master does not break liberty.

We had this support earlier which was removed in change id:
Ia40d8cbf8cef803617509aeca20a9f1ec79d0880

We cannot just revert that change since a lot of changes have
happened since April. We should run this new job against master
as a check job and also should not vote until next summit.

Change-Id: Idcbb3e8c71b0be97c7ab78c426ac363388f46633
'}]
commit_message:
Ability to test oslo master libraries against liberty services

During the Tokyo summit discussions, there were concerns raised
about backward compatability guarantees with oslo libraries. The
main reason was that in liberty global-requirements we do not
cap the versions for oslo libraries and any oslo release in
support of mitaka is likely to break the stable/liberty branch.
We need to add additional jobs to make sure a change in oslo
library in master does not break liberty.

We had this support earlier which was removed in change id:
Ia40d8cbf8cef803617509aeca20a9f1ec79d0880

We cannot just revert that change since a lot of changes have
happened since April. We should run this new job against master
as a check job and also should not vote until next summit.

Change-Id: Idcbb3e8c71b0be97c7ab78c426ac363388f46633

commit_message:
Change haproxy namespace driver to use stevedore alias

This changes haproxy namespace driver to use stevedore alias
rather than full module name for vif driver.

Also fixes 'default argument should not be mutable'
pep8 error.

Change-Id: I6fb779ca9de7ef999505fb4539a3180ecd5ea280
Closes-Bug: #1512937

commit_message:
Optimize get_bridge_for_tap_device

Currently get_bridge_for_tap_device[1] iterates over all neutron bridges
and their interfaces.

This change proposes to deduce interface bridge from:

 /sys/class/net/%(interface)s/brif/bridge

which is a symlink to bridge interface path to improve performance.

[1] neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.linuxbridge.agent.linuxbridge_neutron_agent

Closes-Bug: #1508789
Change-Id: Ia40cd81f47ff082a90d17f58514942ec50553241
(cherry picked from commit 75c881a748941bc6637f3eb10dd5828f32ec6830)
Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_l2_lb_agent.py

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-03 15:02:23.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': 'Use string formatting instead of string replace

Currently linuxbridge_neutron_agent[1] uses the pattern:

 PLACEHOLDER = "..."
 PATH = PREFIX + PLACEHOLDER + SUFFIX
 ...
 my_path = PATH.replace(PLACEHOLDER, my_value)

which could be replaced by the following which is more common and in
general safer:

 PATH = PREFIX + '%s' + SUFFIX
 ...
 my_path = PATH % my_value)

Change-Id: I2d23b11fa6fb7f31c1abbe36523b75bfc81f5c46
(cherry picked from commit a4170cf1bfd3939f54be178e32a258709cc0f76c)
'}]
commit_message:
Use string formatting instead of string replace

Currently linuxbridge_neutron_agent[1] uses the pattern:

 PLACEHOLDER = "..."
 PATH = PREFIX + PLACEHOLDER + SUFFIX
 ...
 my_path = PATH.replace(PLACEHOLDER, my_value)

which could be replaced by the following which is more common and in
general safer:

 PATH = PREFIX + '%s' + SUFFIX
 ...
 my_path = PATH % my_value)

Change-Id: I2d23b11fa6fb7f31c1abbe36523b75bfc81f5c46
(cherry picked from commit a4170cf1bfd3939f54be178e32a258709cc0f76c)

commit_message:
Prepare neutron "use_namespaces" option removal

The neutron use_namespaces option is deprecated since Kilo, it's time
remove it from neutron, neutron-*aas and devstack. This change removes
use_namespaces option usage in unit/functional tests in order to prepare
option removal from neutron and tests testing use_namespace=False case.
This change continues to define use_namespaces option because it's
required by neutron code without using neutron
register_use_namespaces_opts_helper which will be removed from neutron.

Related-Bug: #1508188
Change-Id: I303038eec560a6d99421140c2822aed8b518470b

subject: Added CORS support to Designate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-19 17:49:16.000000000', 'files': ['etc/designate/api-paste.ini'], 'message': 'Added CORS support to Designate

This adds the CORS support middleware to Designate, allowing a deployer
to optionally configure rules under which a javascript client may
break the single-origin policy and access the API directly.

The paste.ini method of deploying the middleware was
chosen, because it needs to be able to annotate error responses
created by other middlewares. If one such middleware throws an
error - such as an auth error from keystone - that error response
must still have CORS headers in order to be readable by the
user agent.

openstack-config-generator hooks were not added in this patch, as
it does not appear that designate explicitly supports them.

OpenStack CrossProject Spec:
   http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/cors-support.html
Oslo_Middleware Docs:
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html
OpenStack Cloud Admin Guide:
   http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/cross_project_cors.html

Change-Id: Ib66e8afafbde568549228c98d210f02466a90cc8
'}]
commit_message:
Added CORS support to Designate

This adds the CORS support middleware to Designate, allowing a deployer
to optionally configure rules under which a javascript client may
break the single-origin policy and access the API directly.

The paste.ini method of deploying the middleware was
chosen, because it needs to be able to annotate error responses
created by other middlewares. If one such middleware throws an
error - such as an auth error from keystone - that error response
must still have CORS headers in order to be readable by the
user agent.

openstack-config-generator hooks were not added in this patch, as
it does not appear that designate explicitly supports them.

OpenStack CrossProject Spec:
   http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/cors-support.html
Oslo_Middleware Docs:
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html
OpenStack Cloud Admin Guide:
   http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/cross_project_cors.html

Change-Id: Ib66e8afafbde568549228c98d210f02466a90cc8

subject: Add composite namevar for tenant, user, user_role.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6525, 'name': 'Gilles Dubreuil', 'email': 'gilles@redhat.com', 'username': 'q-1illes-a'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 7423, 'name': 'Cody Herriges', 'email': 'cody@herriges.org', 'username': 'ody'}, {'_account_id': 8297, 'name': 'Sofer Athlan-Guyot', 'email': 'sathlang@redhat.com', 'username': 'chem'}, {'_account_id': 9983, 'name': 'Richard Megginson', 'email': 'rmeggins@redhat.com', 'username': 'rmeggins'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 47, 'created': '2015-11-03 17:25:57.000000000', 'files': ['spec/acceptance/keystone_federation_identity_provider_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet_x/keystone/type.rb', 'spec/unit/type/keystone_user_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_user_role/openstack.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/keystone_user_role.rb', 'lib/puppet_x/keystone/composite_namevar/helpers/utilities.rb', 'lib/puppet_x/keystone/type/default_domain.rb', 'spec/shared_examples.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone.rb', 'spec/unit/provider/keystone_tenant/openstack_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/keystone_tenant.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/keystone_domain.rb', 'spec/acceptance/default_domain_spec.rb', 'spec/spec_helper_acceptance.rb', 'lib/puppet_x/keystone/composite_namevar/helpers.rb', 'spec/unit/provider/keystone_user/openstack_spec.rb', 'spec/unit/type/keystone_user_role_spec.rb', 'spec/unit/type/keystone_tenant_spec.rb', 'spec/unit/provider/keystone_spec.rb', 'spec/acceptance/keystone_wsgi_apache_spec.rb', 'spec/support/matchers/include_regexp.rb', 'spec/unit/provider/keystone_domain/openstack_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_tenant/openstack.rb', 'spec/acceptance/basic_keystone_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_user/openstack.rb', 'lib/puppet_x/keystone/composite_namevar.rb', 'spec/spec_helper.rb', 'spec/unit/provider/keystone_user_role/openstack_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/keystone_user.rb'], 'message': "Add composite namevar for tenant, user, user_role.

There are two sides on this patch, the user facing one, and the
developer's one.

It gives more flexibility for the interface used by the user for the
Keystone_tenant, Keystone_user and Keystone_user_roles resources.  For
instance to specify a user and give the admin role, currently you have
to:

  keystone_user { 'new_admin::admin_domain':
    ensure      => present,
    enabled     => true,
    tenant      => 'openstackv3::admin_domain',
    email       => 'test@example.tld',
    password    => 'a_big_secret',
  }
  keystone_user_role { 'new_admin::admin_domain@openstackv3::admin_domain':
    ensure         => present,
    roles          => ['admin'],
  }

Now you can specify it like this:

  keystone_user { 'new_admin':
    ensure      => present,
    enabled     => true,
    domain      => 'admin_domain',
    tenant      => 'openstackv3::admin_domain',
    email       => 'test@example.tld',
    password    => 'a_big_secret',
  }
  keystone_user_role { 'new_admin@openstackv3':
    ensure         => present,
    user_domain    => 'admin_domain',
    project_domain => 'admin_domain',
    roles          => ['admin'],
  }

For the developer this simplify the code.  Puppet is using composite
namevar to make all the resources unique.  So guessing what pattern is
used in the title is no longer required.  For instance this :

  keystone_tenant { 'project_one': ensure => present }
  keystone_tenant { 'meaningless': name => 'project_one', domain => 'Default', ensure => present }

is detected as the same tenant by puppet.

The same is true for dependencies. This is working correctly:

  keystone_tenant { 'meaningless': name => 'project_one', domain => 'domain_one', ensure => present }
  file {'/tmp/needed': ensure => present, require => Keystone_tenant['project_one::domain_one'] }

In autorequire term in type definition, you just have to pass the fully
qualified name (with the domain suffix for user and tenant) of the
resource and puppet will do the matching, whatever the original title
is.  See the examples in user and tenant in keystone_user_role type.

Change-Id: I4deb27dc6f71fb7a7ec6a9c72bd0e1412c2e9a30
"}]
commit_message:
Add composite namevar for tenant, user, user_role.

There are two sides on this patch, the user facing one, and the
developer's one.

It gives more flexibility for the interface used by the user for the
Keystone_tenant, Keystone_user and Keystone_user_roles resources.  For
instance to specify a user and give the admin role, currently you have
to:

  keystone_user { 'new_admin::admin_domain':
    ensure      => present,
    enabled     => true,
    tenant      => 'openstackv3::admin_domain',
    email       => 'test@example.tld',
    password    => 'a_big_secret',
  }
  keystone_user_role { 'new_admin::admin_domain@openstackv3::admin_domain':
    ensure         => present,
    roles          => ['admin'],
  }

Now you can specify it like this:

  keystone_user { 'new_admin':
    ensure      => present,
    enabled     => true,
    domain      => 'admin_domain',
    tenant      => 'openstackv3::admin_domain',
    email       => 'test@example.tld',
    password    => 'a_big_secret',
  }
  keystone_user_role { 'new_admin@openstackv3':
    ensure         => present,
    user_domain    => 'admin_domain',
    project_domain => 'admin_domain',
    roles          => ['admin'],
  }

For the developer this simplify the code.  Puppet is using composite
namevar to make all the resources unique.  So guessing what pattern is
used in the title is no longer required.  For instance this :

  keystone_tenant { 'project_one': ensure => present }
  keystone_tenant { 'meaningless': name => 'project_one', domain => 'Default', ensure => present }

is detected as the same tenant by puppet.

The same is true for dependencies. This is working correctly:

  keystone_tenant { 'meaningless': name => 'project_one', domain => 'domain_one', ensure => present }
  file {'/tmp/needed': ensure => present, require => Keystone_tenant['project_one::domain_one'] }

In autorequire term in type definition, you just have to pass the fully
qualified name (with the domain suffix for user and tenant) of the
resource and puppet will do the matching, whatever the original title
is.  See the examples in user and tenant in keystone_user_role type.

Change-Id: I4deb27dc6f71fb7a7ec6a9c72bd0e1412c2e9a30

commit_message:
keystone_endpoint provider for Keystone v3 api

In keystone v3 there is one endpoint per 'interface' (url).
To offer backward compatibility this provider creates a 'virtual' endpoint by
combining the 3 URLs (admin, internal, private) using their 3 IDs in a comma
delimited list.

Implements: blueprint api-v3-support
Change-Id: I8c21b21803805919ae7981ffef74c5e205afe1c1

"xvd" prefix (e.g. xvda0).  The functions to strip partitions need to
match on Xen PV disks otherwise the device name is discarded.

Change-Id: I5539d2afba3fae30d1ddb49dcbf077113d38bbf7
Closes-Bug: #1498576
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for Xen PV disks

Xen paravirtualised disks (supported by most modern kernels) have the
"xvd" prefix (e.g. xvda0).  The functions to strip partitions need to
match on Xen PV disks otherwise the device name is discarded.

Change-Id: I5539d2afba3fae30d1ddb49dcbf077113d38bbf7
Closes-Bug: #1498576

revisions:
[{'number': 32, 'created': '2015-10-22 19:55:15.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/agent.py', 'neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_l3_agent.py', 'neutron/api/rpc/agentnotifiers/l3_rpc_agent_api.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr.py'], 'message': 'Delete fipnamespace when external net removed on DVR

The fipnamespace is associated with an external network
on a given node. In the case of DVR there is just one
single FIP namespace for a given node.

We have seen some race conditions in the agent for creation
and deletion of the fip namespace. See the bug report for
details on the failure.

So in order to address this race condition and make the
code more stable, we will be cleaning up the fip namespace
only when an external network is removed.

The server will be sending a rpc notification message to
the agent to cleanup the fip namespace when the external
net is removed.

This patch address the above mentioned issue by not constantly
deleting and creating the fip namespace.

Closes-Bug: #1501873
Change-Id: I86869f66d4afffad7db09942578b1a456a9bd418
'}]
commit_message:
Delete fipnamespace when external net removed on DVR

The fipnamespace is associated with an external network
on a given node. In the case of DVR there is just one
single FIP namespace for a given node.

We have seen some race conditions in the agent for creation
and deletion of the fip namespace. See the bug report for
details on the failure.

So in order to address this race condition and make the
code more stable, we will be cleaning up the fip namespace
only when an external network is removed.

The server will be sending a rpc notification message to
the agent to cleanup the fip namespace when the external
net is removed.

This patch address the above mentioned issue by not constantly
deleting and creating the fip namespace.

Closes-Bug: #1501873
Change-Id: I86869f66d4afffad7db09942578b1a456a9bd418

commit_message:
add pip cache warming to non dib builder

We also need to warm the cache where we don't use disk image builder,
this copies the method to the old way of doing things as well. It's a
bit denormalized because it's not entirely clear if there is access to
all the elements when run in this mode.

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-10-21 20:34:53.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': "Correct ironic auth settings

The existing ironic.conf uses an unversioned keystone auth_url
setting. As the keystone API now defaults to v3 this can
cause provisioning failures if Ironic needs to communicate
with other services (neutron). This is because we haven't yet
updated TripleO to properly support configuration with
keystone V3.

We also need to set the ironic neutron_url because
if we don't puppet-ironic will use the auth_protocol and
auth_host parameters to construct it incorrectly if
we don't (since we no longer set those parameters).

Change-Id: Ief7fc3dbbd8b8c33ea3ec7bd127231698af27a7f
Depends-On: Ibcc63d82b6e7b9de6ef12209a43f39a4cdecb5a2
Closes-bug: #1495090
"}]
commit_message:
Correct ironic auth settings

The existing ironic.conf uses an unversioned keystone auth_url
setting. As the keystone API now defaults to v3 this can
cause provisioning failures if Ironic needs to communicate
with other services (neutron). This is because we haven't yet
updated TripleO to properly support configuration with
keystone V3.

We also need to set the ironic neutron_url because
if we don't puppet-ironic will use the auth_protocol and
auth_host parameters to construct it incorrectly if
we don't (since we no longer set those parameters).

Change-Id: Ief7fc3dbbd8b8c33ea3ec7bd127231698af27a7f
Depends-On: Ibcc63d82b6e7b9de6ef12209a43f39a4cdecb5a2
Closes-bug: #1495090

commit_message:
Add virt-driver CPU thread pinning

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/virt-driver-cpu-pinning

Resubmit the thread policy aspect of the 'virt-driver-cpu-pinning'
spec, which was not implemented in Kilo.

This is a reproposal of a spec approved for Liberty. However, it
includes new naming for one of the four policies.

Change-Id: I4f75c7182a04903bd89aced654338d0fd2f2ba4d
Blueprint: virt-driver-cpu-pinning
Previously-Approved: Liberty

commit_message:
Use assertTrue/False instead of assertEqual(T/F)

Usage of assertEqual(True/False, ***) should be changed to a more
meaningful format of assertTrue/False(***).

Change-Id: I8623f5534f00ea1690f74a297488957a8d35f074
Closes-Bug: #1510001

Add default stable/liberty branch to .gitreview

This patch adds the defaultbranch tag to the .gitreview file for
stable/liberty to ensure that any reviews done from this branch end up
in the right place on gerrit.

subject: Provide the correct Cinder volume unit size
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-29 01:14:34.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/src/wadls/volume-api/src/v2/os-volume-manage-v2.wadl', 'api-ref/src/wadls/volume-api/src/v2/os-vol-image-meta-v2.wadl', 'api-ref/src/wadls/volume-api/src/v2/volume-api-v2.wadl', 'api-ref/src/wadls/volume-api/src/v2/common.ent'], 'message': 'Provide the correct Cinder volume unit size

Both Horizon and the cinder client documents the size paramater in
gigabyes(GB) but the API docs(both v1 and v2) list the size units as
gibibytes(GiB). The correct unit should be gigabytes(GB).

Change-Id: I4613e40d7aa2eb53c5718b0bbce693ef30951ec6
Closes-Bug: 1511167
'}]
commit_message:
Provide the correct Cinder volume unit size

Both Horizon and the cinder client documents the size paramater in
gigabyes(GB) but the API docs(both v1 and v2) list the size units as
gibibytes(GiB). The correct unit should be gigabytes(GB).

Change-Id: I4613e40d7aa2eb53c5718b0bbce693ef30951ec6
Closes-Bug: 1511167

commit_message:
Use _assert_has_(no)_errors() in hacking tests

_assert_has_errors() and _assert_has_no_errors() us much easier to read
and understand. This change switches over the tests to use those fixture
methods.

Change-Id: I4aa8f973d1be34739a7fb2edcf85a956b2cf7859
Closes-Bug: #1512802

subject: Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-11-04 17:13:48.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', '.fixtures.yml', 'Rakefile', 'Gemfile', 'spec/classes/nova_rabbitmq_spec.rb'], 'message': "Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

It also stop testing nova::rabbitmq which is something we don't want
to support anymore. It's included in this commit otherwise unit tests
will fail.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Depends-On: Ifa4026fb9407cd7f43685c89ac69e60588783915
Change-Id: Id33c964252cbd1fa1e1b2d06ae946da7fca9bcf5
"}]
commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

It also stop testing nova::rabbitmq which is something we don't want
to support anymore. It's included in this commit otherwise unit tests
will fail.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Depends-On: Ifa4026fb9407cd7f43685c89ac69e60588783915
Change-Id: Id33c964252cbd1fa1e1b2d06ae946da7fca9bcf5

commit_message:
Normalize int config values to string

We have no things that expect actual int values. It's easy to write
ints in yaml though - so normalize them to strings.

Change-Id: I58cfdda697da9b7e030f4165ef8e60f4e9d00b66

Implements support for multiple local subnets for IPSec site to site
connections, using the new Endpoint Group API.

The implementation supports backwards compatibility as follows. If
a VPN service is created with a subnet, then the older API is assumed
and the user must specify the peer CIDRs for any IPSec connections
and cannot specify multiple local subnets.

If a subnet is not provided for the VPN service, then the user must
use the newer API and provide a local and peer endpoint group IDs for
the IPSec connection (and cannot specify the peer CIDRs in the IPSec
connection API).

Implication here is that the subnet will be an optional argument for
the VPN service API.

With this feature, when an endpoint group is deleted, a check is made
to ensure that there are no IPSec connections using the group.

Migration will move the subnet from VPN service API to a new endpoint
group, and specify the group in any connections using the service.
The peer CIDR(s) will be moved from each connection to an endpoint
group, with the group ID specified in the connection.

Note: As part of testing the database methods for this feature, several
more tests were created to test database access only, instead of doing
a round trip test. In a separate commit, these tests can be expanded,
and the existing round trip tests removed.

Note: Tests for building the dict used in sync requests was enhanced,
as part of supporting this feature. The previous tests didn't check
that the peer CIDR information was correct, so were enhanced as well.

Note: The service driver passes the local CIDR(s) in a new field,
called local_cidrs. This field is used for the older API, as well,
passing the subnet's CIDR, and allowing consistent consumption by the
device driver. The IP version is also passed, rather than obtaining
it from the subnet info (so both new and old API use the same fields).

Note: to support rolling upgrades, where an agent may be using the older
release, after the server has been updated, the subnet CIDR field passed
from the service driver to device driver, will be populated from the
first local endpoint from the first connection (there has to be at least
one connection, when sending data to the agent).

Note: In the device driver, I noticed that the local CIDR's IP version
can change the config file output, so I added test cases for IPv6, as
part of enhancing the tests for multiple local CIDRs.

Change-Id: I7a011e3170d7db463a6561e550b2ead3e3311125
Partial-Bug: 1459423
"}]
commit_message:
VPNaaS: Multiple Local Subnets feature

Implements support for multiple local subnets for IPSec site to site
connections, using the new Endpoint Group API.

The implementation supports backwards compatibility as follows. If
a VPN service is created with a subnet, then the older API is assumed
and the user must specify the peer CIDRs for any IPSec connections
and cannot specify multiple local subnets.

If a subnet is not provided for the VPN service, then the user must
use the newer API and provide a local and peer endpoint group IDs for
the IPSec connection (and cannot specify the peer CIDRs in the IPSec
connection API).

Implication here is that the subnet will be an optional argument for
the VPN service API.

With this feature, when an endpoint group is deleted, a check is made
to ensure that there are no IPSec connections using the group.

Migration will move the subnet from VPN service API to a new endpoint
group, and specify the group in any connections using the service.
The peer CIDR(s) will be moved from each connection to an endpoint
group, with the group ID specified in the connection.

Note: As part of testing the database methods for this feature, several
more tests were created to test database access only, instead of doing
a round trip test. In a separate commit, these tests can be expanded,
and the existing round trip tests removed.

Note: Tests for building the dict used in sync requests was enhanced,
as part of supporting this feature. The previous tests didn't check
that the peer CIDR information was correct, so were enhanced as well.

Note: The service driver passes the local CIDR(s) in a new field,
called local_cidrs. This field is used for the older API, as well,
passing the subnet's CIDR, and allowing consistent consumption by the
device driver. The IP version is also passed, rather than obtaining
it from the subnet info (so both new and old API use the same fields).

Note: to support rolling upgrades, where an agent may be using the older
release, after the server has been updated, the subnet CIDR field passed
from the service driver to device driver, will be populated from the
first local endpoint from the first connection (there has to be at least
one connection, when sending data to the agent).

Note: In the device driver, I noticed that the local CIDR's IP version
can change the config file output, so I added test cases for IPv6, as
part of enhancing the tests for multiple local CIDRs.

Change-Id: I7a011e3170d7db463a6561e550b2ead3e3311125
Partial-Bug: 1459423

commit_message:
Fix infinite spinner for Angular panels

Allow Angular panels to refresh when URI and the
link location is the same.

The solution is based off comments at

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/16002984/angularjs-how-can-i-do-a-redirect-with-a-full-page-load

Closes Bug: #1506211

commit_message:
Don't hide Karma coverage reports

This patch updates the file names of the coverage reports so they are
visible by default on most systems. Also updates the .gitignore, so the
new files are not pushed to the Horizon repo.

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: 1508526
Change-Id: I3c1c8f4c88819e2f49b60722ea8cc37bdc711b8c

As part of building a reliable UI, I am including tests around our
core components.

There is a minor change made to HomeController: instead of getting the
current date as part of the loading process, the date is injected once
the controller is loaded. That helps us testing the controller behavior.

Change-Id: Id19bc9e212329990a415077f53924321ce737bed

commit_message:
Add unit tests around HomeController

As part of building a reliable UI, I am including tests around our
core components.

There is a minor change made to HomeController: instead of getting the
current date as part of the loading process, the date is injected once
the controller is loaded. That helps us testing the controller behavior.

Change-Id: Id19bc9e212329990a415077f53924321ce737bed

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-04 17:52:28.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/cache-devstack/install.d/60-pip-warm-cache'], 'message': 'warm pip wheel cache during image build

This installs everything in upper-constraints in a throw away venv,
which has the knock on effect of fully populating the wheel cache for
root with wheels for everything. This hopefully speeds up all devstack
runs quite a bit.

Change-Id: I429f353c33d892f76552c83d34ac1329ed18f97f
'}]
commit_message:
warm pip wheel cache during image build

This installs everything in upper-constraints in a throw away venv,
which has the knock on effect of fully populating the wheel cache for
root with wheels for everything. This hopefully speeds up all devstack
runs quite a bit.

Change-Id: I429f353c33d892f76552c83d34ac1329ed18f97f

commit_message:
Remove references to router_delete_namespaces option in tests

Deprecated router_delete_namespaces option was removed in neutron
by change I2a879213c3b095a007a4531f430a33cea9fdf1bd and this caused
failures of functional tests.
We should remove all references to this option.

Change-Id: I80cc5bc1037c974a816466f94f354927ba21c726

subject: Fix volume size units to match the API
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-03 23:26:12.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/v1/shell.py', 'cinderclient/v2/shell.py'], 'message': 'Fix volume size units to match the API

Both Horizon and the cinder client documents the size paramater in
gigabyes(GBs) but the API docs(both v1 and v2) list the size units as
gibibytes(GiBs). The correct unit should be gibibytes(GiBs). This
should help in clearing up any confusion on what units are used in
Cinder.

Closes-bug: 1511167
Change-Id: I42e15c18d1f084d435a2be9b343fb2f6c3cf377f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix volume size units to match the API

Both Horizon and the cinder client documents the size paramater in
gigabyes(GBs) but the API docs(both v1 and v2) list the size units as
gibibytes(GiBs). The correct unit should be gibibytes(GiBs). This
should help in clearing up any confusion on what units are used in
Cinder.

Closes-bug: 1511167
Change-Id: I42e15c18d1f084d435a2be9b343fb2f6c3cf377f

commit_message:
Honor rabbitmq username/password

If a rabbitmq username/password were set in undercloud.conf previously,
they were not honored, and all services would fail to connect to rabbit.
Also cleans up the way we include rabbit in the puppet manifest to bring
it inline with how it's done for the Overcloud.

Change-Id: If851db7edf3e2fc5fbd0722ebf3df6e5b16681a0

subject: Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7156, 'name': 'Mathieu Gagné', 'email': 'mgagne@calavera.ca', 'username': 'mgagne'}, {'_account_id': 7745, 'name': 'Denis Egorenko', 'email': 'degorenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'degorenko'}, {'_account_id': 9061, 'name': 'David Moreau Simard', 'email': 'moi@dmsimard.com', 'username': 'dmsimard'}, {'_account_id': 9500, 'name': 'Matt Fischer', 'email': 'matt@mattfischer.com', 'username': 'mfisch'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-11-04 16:49:17.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', '.fixtures.yml', 'Rakefile', 'Gemfile'], 'message': "Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: I4b72eef7fd4d4ee7b226a5014b7d180506161f69
"}]
commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: I4b72eef7fd4d4ee7b226a5014b7d180506161f69

subject: clarify the example in 'Simulation with Actions'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-27 12:31:31.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/enforcement.rst'], 'message': 'clarify the example in 'Simulation with Actions'

In RST document congress/doc/source/enforcement.rst.

The policy 'aliceactions' is created at first in the example,
but that is never used, all the following command use the
default 'action' policy, that make the users confused about
which policy we should create "action('set')" rule into and
which action policy we should use in simulate? Aims to clarify
the usage, avoid to use default 'action' policy, and use
'aliceactions' policy in the example.

Change-Id: I1c976120c20b8e766a6692d3ab16e91f92da8b5c
Closes-Bug: #1510428
'}]
commit_message:
clarify the example in 'Simulation with Actions'

In RST document congress/doc/source/enforcement.rst.

The policy 'aliceactions' is created at first in the example,
but that is never used, all the following command use the
default 'action' policy, that make the users confused about
which policy we should create "action('set')" rule into and
which action policy we should use in simulate? Aims to clarify
the usage, avoid to use default 'action' policy, and use
'aliceactions' policy in the example.

Change-Id: I1c976120c20b8e766a6692d3ab16e91f92da8b5c
Closes-Bug: #1510428

subject: Fixing bug in injection test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-04 16:55:36.000000000', 'files': ['bandit/plugins/injection_shell.py'], 'message': 'Fixing bug in injection test

The injection test was broken, it assumed that the call arg in the
context would reflect the type passed into the detected call, this
is not the case. We check the AST node type instead now

Change-Id: Idd7d8ed5ab7062af79b8e77d6df0cc39bddb7663
Closes-bug: 1513091
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing bug in injection test

The injection test was broken, it assumed that the call arg in the
context would reflect the type passed into the detected call, this
is not the case. We check the AST node type instead now

Change-Id: Idd7d8ed5ab7062af79b8e77d6df0cc39bddb7663
Closes-bug: 1513091

commit_message:
run_tests: install puppet from puppetlabs.com repo

Use puppetlabs.com repositories to handle Puppet packaging, like it's
done in Beaker jobs.

That way, we will run the latest version available in Puppetlabs
repositories, in a consistent way with beaker jobs.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-21 00:36:06.000000000', 'files': ['congress/policy_engines/agnostic.py'], 'message': "Sets loaded rule info to Rule instances

Policy Engine initializes Rule instances when Congress starts
if rules are persited in db. The bug is that Policy Engine only
loads persited rule string but doesn't set other infomation,
id, name and comment. This patch lets Policy Engine set the
lacked infomations to Rule instance.

Closes-Bug: #1507329
Change-Id: Id8354d9bff0d5b5938406473e2f344e726bd2f3c
(cherry picked from commit 19dd02831ec995c4bcabc256bac1b0dde5088bb5)
"}]
commit_message:
Sets loaded rule info to Rule instances

Policy Engine initializes Rule instances when Congress starts
if rules are persited in db. The bug is that Policy Engine only
loads persited rule string but doesn't set other infomation,
id, name and comment. This patch lets Policy Engine set the
lacked infomations to Rule instance.

Closes-Bug: #1507329
Change-Id: Id8354d9bff0d5b5938406473e2f344e726bd2f3c
(cherry picked from commit 19dd02831ec995c4bcabc256bac1b0dde5088bb5)

commit_message:
Manage keystone initialization directly in t-h-t manifests

This is the second change of a servies of two, it creates the
user, user_role, service and endpoint for:

  * glance
  * nova
  * neutron
  * cinder
  * horizon
  * swift
  * ceilometer
  * heat

Change-Id: I50e792d98a2ba516ff498c58ad402f463c5f7e76

commit_message:
Add a script to start and monitor children processes

start_processes.py starts processes described in a config file.
start_processes.py will restart processes that die if configured with
restart_delay.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-29 08:20:19.000000000', 'files': ['congress/tests/datasources/fakes.py', 'congress/tests/datasources/test_nova_driver.py', 'congress/datasources/nova_driver.py'], 'message': 'Add availability zone information into nova driver

The user can specify which AZ is used to boot up a vm. Since AZ can be
also used to separate security zones it is very useful to have this
information in Congress in order to monitor if VMs are placed in the
right network and uses the correct volume backend.

For more detail information see [1].

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/telcowg-usecases/blob/master/usecases/sec_segregation.rst

Change-Id: Ie53a0fa0600a20f478791a81e7c750378e91476b
'}]
commit_message:
Add availability zone information into nova driver

The user can specify which AZ is used to boot up a vm. Since AZ can be
also used to separate security zones it is very useful to have this
information in Congress in order to monitor if VMs are placed in the
right network and uses the correct volume backend.

For more detail information see [1].

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/telcowg-usecases/blob/master/usecases/sec_segregation.rst

Change-Id: Ie53a0fa0600a20f478791a81e7c750378e91476b

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-11-03 18:44:00.000000000', 'files': ['priorities/mitaka-priorities.rst'], 'message': 'Add Mitaka Priorities

commit_message:
Add tripleo F22 periodic jobs

Run the 3 tripleo jobs daily, these can be used to test the most recent
trunk repository. Once the patch triggered ci jobs have moved to F22 we
can use these to trigger a promotion of trunk repositories used by tripleo.

commit_message:
Allow overriding values using args in ServicePlugin

Some of the subclasses of ServicePlugin allow overriding the
service_api_url using args. This could be useful for all
plugins so move that code into ServicePlugin.

Also allow overriding of process_names, search_pattern,
overwrite and template_dir.

Remove the code in the ironic and trove plugins that duplicated
this code.

Added a unit test for this code.

Change-Id: Ibd97effa6d5bff0cf621e4bdcbe6f5b781d195f4

commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

It also stop testing manila::rabbitmq which is something we don't want
to support anymore. It's included in this commit otherwise unit tests
will fail.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Depends-On: Ifa4026fb9407cd7f43685c89ac69e60588783915
Change-Id: I7763fcb25efbe7ccee16f3cf1d796fcfbe977280

commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Also do not test cinder::rabbitmq anymore, due to an issue with
rabbitmq::server class. This class is deprecated for a while and we drop
it in master.

Change-Id: Iadcef8079efb8c94282c5cdefb91bfa3920f3919

subject: Cisco Nexus ML2 MD: Need unique key for server level keys in hieradata
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-15 16:17:51.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/extraconfig/all_nodes/neutron-ml2-cisco-nexus-ucsm.yaml'], 'message': 'Cisco Nexus ML2 MD: Need unique key for server level keys in hieradata

Due to a limitation in the puppet version used in RHEL7 there is no simple
way to scope a 2nd level hiera hash key with the create_resources + defined
types pattern.  Lack of the .each method support prior to puppet 4.0 is the
problem here.  This template change works around the problem by explicitly
adding the hostname to the hieradata for a server under a nexus switch.

The duplicate server names under different switches is needed for vPC
config scenarios.

Closes-bug: #1506546
Change-Id: I03b866fb440e968c9f86ae93942b687e7165a065
'}]
commit_message:
Cisco Nexus ML2 MD: Need unique key for server level keys in hieradata

Due to a limitation in the puppet version used in RHEL7 there is no simple
way to scope a 2nd level hiera hash key with the create_resources + defined
types pattern.  Lack of the .each method support prior to puppet 4.0 is the
problem here.  This template change works around the problem by explicitly
adding the hostname to the hieradata for a server under a nexus switch.

The duplicate server names under different switches is needed for vPC
config scenarios.

Closes-bug: #1506546
Change-Id: I03b866fb440e968c9f86ae93942b687e7165a065

subject: Fixing Baseline when a filter is used
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-04 09:17:00.000000000', 'files': ['bandit/formatters/csv.py', 'bandit/core/issue.py', 'bandit/formatters/xml.py', 'bandit/core/manager.py', 'bandit/formatters/json.py', 'bandit/formatters/text.py', 'bandit/formatters/html.py'], 'message': "Fixing Baseline when a filter is used

This current baseline doesn't work if a filter is provided due
to the details mentioned here:
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/bandit/+bug/1512360

This fixes it by implementing the severity and confidence
filtering before baseline filtering.

Additionally, since each formatter used an IF statement to check
severity after getting issues, we've just moved the filtering to
the get_issues call.  If for some reason a formatter wants
to get unfiltered, they can omit the call.

Change-Id: I39c1d826f44a8c0d829fb7017d03dbff25779cba
Closes-Bug: #1512360
"}]
commit_message:
Fixing Baseline when a filter is used

This current baseline doesn't work if a filter is provided due
to the details mentioned here:
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/bandit/+bug/1512360

This fixes it by implementing the severity and confidence
filtering before baseline filtering.

Additionally, since each formatter used an IF statement to check
severity after getting issues, we've just moved the filtering to
the get_issues call.  If for some reason a formatter wants
to get unfiltered, they can omit the call.

Change-Id: I39c1d826f44a8c0d829fb7017d03dbff25779cba
Closes-Bug: #1512360

subject: Making score sum totals more sane
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-04 06:48:53.000000000', 'files': ['bandit/core/node_visitor.py', 'bandit/formatters/json.py', 'bandit/formatters/text.py', 'bandit/core/utils.py', 'tests/unit/formatters/test_json.py'], 'message': "Making score sum totals more sane

This commit revamps the score sum system that was currently used
by JSON and TXT formatters.  The new approach is that an
aggregate SEVERITY and CONFIDENCE score is shown.

Previously the sum of all scores was added in a confusing way and
reported separately for each file in JSON metrics.  Text didn't
work at all, if you actually wanted to display them (with -v) it
crashed.

Change-Id: Id0c1f97795c6e1030b7fffcb1481da9c390dc4c1
Closes-Bug: #1512335
Closes-Bug: #1512333
"}]
commit_message:
Making score sum totals more sane

This commit revamps the score sum system that was currently used
by JSON and TXT formatters.  The new approach is that an
aggregate SEVERITY and CONFIDENCE score is shown.

Previously the sum of all scores was added in a confusing way and
reported separately for each file in JSON metrics.  Text didn't
work at all, if you actually wanted to display them (with -v) it
crashed.

Change-Id: Id0c1f97795c6e1030b7fffcb1481da9c390dc4c1
Closes-Bug: #1512335
Closes-Bug: #1512333

subject: Fixing Traceback with Bad File
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-04 07:58:58.000000000', 'files': ['bandit/core/metrics.py'], 'message': "Fixing Traceback with Bad File

This commit fixes a bug that was causing a traceback when running
Bandit against a single file with bad syntax.  The total metrics
count dictionary previously had no initial value, so if we had
a problem updating with new ones, we'd end up in a situation where
we never had a valid total count.  This fixes it by initializing
totals to 0 at metrics init time.

Change-Id: Ib7f1f54d0d6a0e9ffbb2cc3fc40b17b0c50ce0ca
Closes-Bug: #1512957
Closes-Bug: #1511431
"}]
commit_message:
Fixing Traceback with Bad File

This commit fixes a bug that was causing a traceback when running
Bandit against a single file with bad syntax.  The total metrics
count dictionary previously had no initial value, so if we had
a problem updating with new ones, we'd end up in a situation where
we never had a valid total count.  This fixes it by initializing
totals to 0 at metrics init time.

Change-Id: Ib7f1f54d0d6a0e9ffbb2cc3fc40b17b0c50ce0ca
Closes-Bug: #1512957
Closes-Bug: #1511431

commit_message:
Added CORS support to Magnum

This adds the CORS support middleware to Magnum, allowing a deployer
to optionally configure rules under which a javascript client may
break the single-origin policy and access the API directly.

For magnum, the CORS middleware was directly added to the setup_app
method, as the last middleware to be wrapped around the application
instance. Common headers were added, in order to avoid magic
configuration moments where a feature does not function without
an operator having to read code.

OpenStack CrossProject Spec:
   http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/cors-support.html
Oslo_Middleware Docs:
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html
OpenStack Cloud Admin Guide:
   http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/cross_project_cors.html
DocImpact

Change-Id: I7e6d7e2145e3bf883b8a28071c949e10e5c207e0
Closes-bug: #1508209

Add new eventlet config option 'url_length_limit'

This is to allow overriding eventlet's default of 8192. That might be needed
when trying to revoke large tokens using the v2 API.

subject: Restrict certain APIs to cloud admin in domain-aware policy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-13 09:52:29.000000000', 'files': ['etc/policy.v3cloudsample.json'], 'message': 'Restrict certain APIs to cloud admin in domain-aware policy

Some of the APIs in the domain-aware policy file are currently
allowed by any "admin" user, when they should really be locked
down to the cloud admin.  Without this, users who are a project
admin will be allowed to do things like manage regions, IdPs,
and other objects that they should not be allowed to touch.

Change-Id: Ifca8bc2fffd2d8c1bf02373d1fadd459a77f836c
Closes-bug: #1381809
(cherry picked from commit fdbad9f530ea4478d96437b021c9b5cc6d338901)
'}]
commit_message:
Restrict certain APIs to cloud admin in domain-aware policy

Some of the APIs in the domain-aware policy file are currently
allowed by any "admin" user, when they should really be locked
down to the cloud admin.  Without this, users who are a project
admin will be allowed to do things like manage regions, IdPs,
and other objects that they should not be allowed to touch.

Change-Id: Ifca8bc2fffd2d8c1bf02373d1fadd459a77f836c
Closes-bug: #1381809
(cherry picked from commit fdbad9f530ea4478d96437b021c9b5cc6d338901)

commit_message:
QoS BW limits do not affect network devices

bandwidth limits do not affect the ports of network devices.

Closes-bug: #1496613
